At times when the worker was cleaning the long holes of the production mesh in negative, when removing the polyethylene pipe it suffers a clogging inside the drill, which product of compressed air pressure is released by ejecting detritus and fragments of rock inside the hole impacting the worker's forehead causing a cut.

Once the ore loading in the LT-30 locomotive was completed; the penultimate car derails (7th car), by the presence of fragment of rock in the railway line, (weight of the car with mineral 8 tons), and to get it back on track the mining car, the victim makes use of a metal tube (length 1.20 meters and 4 "diameter) to maneuver and reposition the mining car; at that moment the metallic tube loses stability and imprisons the victim's hand against the strut of the mining car. The collaborator at the time of the event towards the use of his leather gloves.

At level 3450 access 4 A2, the operator of the Scissor # 200 performed the support of the crown, at which time a piece of rock (13cmx6cmx2cm; 54g) passes between the cocada of the support mesh, from a height of 1.60 meters, towards the platform of the team breaking into particles one of which reaches his right eye causing the injury.

Mr. Emerson was moving trays; when climbing the staircase that gives access to the former dining room and finding himself on the last step, he slips and falls to the floor; supporting the body forward, suffering blows to the right knee with the floor, as well as in the nose with the metal trays it was carrying, causing a cut in the nose and ematoma in the knee.
When opened the access ladder of the people carrying Truck the employee had his right hand pressed into the support bracket of the same, suffering a superficial injury.

In phase I, the operator carried out the removal of inchancanbles of the reciprocating feeder, while removing a split set with the support of a rope, the staff supports the left hand on the structure of the protection against falling, it is at this moment that another split set comes out together with the load and hits on the distal phalanx of the fifth finger of the left hand, generating the described injury.

At times when the mill operator proceeded to remove the vitaulic flange connecting the suction pipe to the pump housing 8B; with the intention of de-sanding the system, when removing the flange, the mineral pulp comes out under pressure and impacts on the face and wrist of his left hand generating the lesion described. Being 05:30 am. Approximately Marco and Isidro TORRES they were performing the pipe standardization of the CX 771 / CX-983 Nv. 1940; in moments that Marco lifts the air pipe over the spike, this seat and the pipe impacts on the worker's safety guard.
Employee was sitting in the resting area at level 326 (raise bore), when he suffered sudden illness, falling and suffering excoriation on the face.

Team of the VMS Project performed soil collection on the Xixás target with 3 members. When the teams were moving from one collection point to another, Mr. Fabio was ahead of the team, stinging behind Robson and Manoel da Silva. near the collection point were surprised by a swarm of bees that was inside a I play near the ground, with no visibility in the woods and no hissing noise. Fabio passed by the stump, but Robson and Manoel da Silva were attacked by the bees. Robson had a sting in his left arm over his uniform and Manoel da Silva had a prick in his lip as his screen ripped as he tangled in the branches during the escape.

Employee reports that he was supervising an activity in the Ustulation, near the Ball when a projection of hot humped dust from the upper floor reached his cervical ("neck" region), causing a first degree burn.

Employee reports that when attempting to manually ingot of Zinco, on the rotary table of the L1 ingot, hit with the left hand against the angle in the structure of the ingot, by pressing the finger between the ingot and the angle.

At approximately 5:45 pm, the operator Paulo (operator of the filters) informed the autoclave operator via radio of a leak on the side of the scruber. The autoclave III feed was stopped by the control and officials Georli and Renato initiated the procedures for closing the autoclave transfer valve for flash TQs. Being approximately 5:45 pm. On the level. 1710 Cx 018 BP 745, in circumstances that the workers of the company Rock performed the anchorage of the central pin for the anchoring of the drilling machine Diamantina XRD -30 (bob Cat) the assistant Cristian (injured) made the adjustment of the nut of the central bolt with the stilson key No. 18 Simultaneously Jose from the control panel made the movement of the rotation unit for the positioning of the clamp pin, at that moment the frame is slid by pressing the thumb of the assistant's left hand against the stilson key, causing the described injury, due to the lack of securing the frame fixing bolts.
Upon entering the building, the maid slipped and fell just behind the automatic door, in front of the entry mat. The floor was wet and slippery.

When conducting inspection to evaluate activity to be carried out in the pump house of the Ustulation steam station, it was struck by sulfuric acid spills from a line located above the house of thermal recovery boiler pumps.

In access 2 of level 3910, during the installation activity of hydraulic filling pipes of 4 "diameter, when installing a section 80 m to a height of 5.6 m with reference to the floor, the master of hydraulic filling - accident - and his partner suffers an attrition of the right hand between the upper edge of the scoop lamp and the roof of the work generating the injury. At the time of the accident the employee used his rubber gloves.

Approx. 18:40 hours, Mr. Luis maintenance team of mobile equipment, adjusted a bolt of the front loader J005A, at which time his face is impacted by the key used for this activity, producing a slight cut in the surface of the face. He is transferred to the medical service, attended and registered.
The maid while walking in the electrolysis area, stumbled and fell next to the bathroom in room B.

In circumstances that two workers of the company INCIMMET made the loading of explosives using an equipment anfoloader, in a front of the work - sustained with shotcreterepentinamente of the right superior part of the crown, a piece of rock of approx. 9. kg, (0.2mx0.15mx0.10m), impacting on the basket and on the back of the helper who was in the basket suspended at 2.2 m height, moments later a block of rock is detached from the wall of the gable approx. 1,500 kg. (1.20mx1.10mx0.40m), which impacts the ampoloader team and part of this block injures the operator of the ampoloader team who was standing on the ground. The equipment anfoloader has a cabin with protection ROPs and FOPs, at the time of the accident both workers used helmets and safety boots. Both suffered polyontusions and minor scoria injuries.

In the Raise chamber, when the operator and assistant removed the drilling bar from the 71R drilling machine - weight approx. 500 Kg - holding it at the top with a 2 TM stroke and assisted with jibs to move horizontally, the operator's jib on the bottom slides by moving the top of the drill bar causing the assistant's bar to enforce his assistant's hand between the bar and the piston of the equipment.

When installing the ripper pin of the tractor D6T-N1, the ripper support arm slides by pressing the second and third fingers of the right hand against the base of the ripper causing the injury described.

At 18:40 hours, in moments when Mr. Claudio tipper operator readjusted the nuts of the rear tire on the right side of his vehicle, using a wheel wrench and a tube as an extension to generate greater force of torque; which was Mr. Wilber held him in his back; suffers a contusion in the palm of the right hand as the extension to his partner slips from his hands.

While maintaining the ramp 604, when placing the first cloth for the overlap with the previous mesh; the operator will check the work front, then return to the back of the team to coordinate with his assistant, at which time a fragment of rock (Weight: 0.42 kg) of the non-sustained area will be detached, which impacts on the arm of the team and reaching by bounce the collaborator causing the injury. The one involved made use of all their EPPs. At the time of the incident the assistant was in the back of the team preparing the support mesh.

During maintenance operations on conveyor belt 12, collaborator Ana accidentally knocks over a stack of metal drums while navigating around an obstacle. One drum rolls away and falls into a shallow pit filled with lubricant oil, causing her to slip and fall onto the oily surface at approximately 14:20 pm.

During a routine inspection in the storage area, an employee was moving a stack of pallets when he lost his balance due to uneven flooring and fell onto a sharp edge of a metal crate, causing a 5cm laceration on his right elbow. The impact also resulted in minor bruising around the affected area.

During a routine maintenance procedure on the conveyor belt system, an employee attempted to loosen a stubborn bolt using a wrench. As they applied additional force, the tool slipped and struck their left index finger, causing a laceration approximately 2 cm in length.

While performing routine maintenance on a conveyor belt system, an employee's gloved hand became entangled in a rotating drum assembly as they attempted to dislodge debris from the machinery. The sudden stop of the drum caused the entwined arm to jerk violently against the metal frame, resulting in a deep laceration above the wrist and minor bruising on the forearm.

During a routine maintenance procedure on a conveyor belt system, an employee's gloved hand slipped off the worn-out grip of a moving pulley wheel, causing minor lacerations and bruising due to friction with the metal surface. The worker was not wearing proper personal protective equipment at the time of the incident.

During a routine maintenance operation on level 214 GTS, an employee from contractor XYZ suffered a minor injury when a dropped toolbox weighing approximately 25 kg fell onto their right ankle, causing a bruise and swelling in the affected area.

At approximately 2:15 pm on level 2100 Cx 012 BP 765, during routine maintenance operations at the mineral processing plant, a mechanical failure occurred when operator Marcelo attempted to loosen a stuck valve on pump unit 5A. As he applied excessive force with his right hand, the valve suddenly released under pressure, striking him in the face and causing lacerations above the eyebrow. The incident happened despite proper use of safety goggles by the employee at the time of the accident.

During a routine maintenance operation on the conveyor belt system in the processing area, an employee suffered minor injuries when a falling metal plate struck his left hand and wrist while he was walking nearby. The incident occurred due to inadequate securing of the loose plate by previous workers, which led to its unintended release from the assembly line.

Employee José suffered a minor injury while performing maintenance on the conveyor belt system in area TQ 18 B. During the procedure, he accidentally touched an exposed electrical cable with his gloved hand, causing a brief shock and resulting in mild numbness in his fingers. The employee was treated by first aid responders at the scene and subsequently released to return to work after a short period of observation.

During routine maintenance on a conveyor belt system, Mr. Patel's gloved hand slipped off the worn-out grip of the tensioning tool as he attempted to adjust its position. The sudden loss of control caused the tool to strike his left wrist, resulting in a deep laceration and bruising.

In the course of replacing a faulty conveyor belt section on the upper level of the storage facility 300 meters from the main processing area, an employee was struck by a falling bundle of loose wire rods measuring approximately 10 cm in diameter and weighing around 20 kg. The impact occurred when the worker attempted to redirect the rolling rods using his right hand, resulting in lacerations on the forearm and wrist.

During a routine inspection on belt 12, collaborator Ana accidentally steps into an uncovered pit left behind by maintenance personnel, approximately 0.75m deep and partially hidden from view. She suffered minor cuts and bruises upon falling but was able to climb out unassisted; medical attention was sought as a precautionary measure.

During a routine maintenance operation at the processing plant's storage area, an employee was attempting to loosen a stuck valve handle using a wrench while standing on a raised platform. As he applied pressure, his foot slipped off the edge and he lost balance, causing him to fall onto the nearby electrical panel. The impact resulted in minor injuries, including cuts and bruises, but fortunately did not trigger any electrical malfunctions or equipment damage.

During maintenance operations on a conveyor belt system, an employee's gloved hand slipped off the worn-out grip of a loose pulley wheel while attempting to tighten it with pliers, resulting in a deep laceration above the wrist area.

At 3:20 p.m., during a routine inspection in the storage area of the chemical plant, engineer Rodriguez slipped on an oil spill while walking down the stairs, landing awkwardly and twisting his right ankle, resulting in a moderate sprain. The incident was reported to management immediately after first aid treatment was administered.

During a routine maintenance operation on a conveyor belt in the processing area, an employee was struck by falling debris when a broken pulley wheel dislodged and fell from its support beam, hitting his right shoulder with moderate force, causing bruising and superficial lacerations.

While attempting to replace a faulty gear on conveyor belt 345, Mr. Patel's gloved hand slipped off the tool handle due to excessive grease residue, causing his index finger to get pinched between the moving rollers and the stationary frame of the machine, resulting in minor lacerations.

At 9:15 am on level 3, in area C-1234 BP 4567, during maintenance operations of conveyor belt No. 2, operator Ana attempted to remove a stuck screwdriver from the drive pulley using pliers while colleague Carlos was operating the adjacent section's control panel. As Ana applied force with her right hand, she lost grip on the pliers and they slipped into the moving conveyor rollers, causing lacerations on her left wrist due to inadequate safety measures during maintenance procedures.

While adjusting a conveyor belt's tensioning system, Mr. García accidentally pinched his right index finger between two adjacent rollers as he tried to loosen a stuck bolt with both hands. The pressure caused minor bruising and swelling in the affected area, requiring immediate medical attention but not posing an imminent threat to life or limb.

At approximately 02:45 p.m., in Well #1234, Section C-2, Employee John, a driller's assistant on Rig 4567, was attempting to clear debris from the drill floor when he accidentally knocked over an open pipe wrench, which slid across the surface and struck his right ankle.

At a production site in Sector 3, an employee was tasked with replacing a faulty gear on a machinery component. While attempting to loosen the bolt using a wrench, he lost his grip due to excessive torque and pressure applied by his left hand. The sudden release of tension caused the wrench to slip out of his grasp, striking the index finger of his right hand against the metal frame, resulting in an injury.

At approximately 02:15 pm in Nv. 1234, CX-567, Mr. Alex, a technician of Unit 34, was performing routine maintenance on the hydraulic system of the drilling machine XRD -25 (JCB). While adjusting the pressure gauge with his right hand using pliers, he inadvertently pressed the thumb against the exposed pipe, causing it to slide and strike the index finger of his left hand. The injury occurred due to inadequate securing of loose pipes in the area.

During the maintenance activity on a conveyor belt system, an employee attempted to adjust a misaligned roller by pushing it back into place using his left hand, resulting in accidental finger pinching between the moving parts and causing injury.

While attempting to tighten a loose bolt on a conveyor belt pulley system, an employee's gloved hand slipped off the wrench and became wedged between the moving part and the stationary frame, resulting in lacerations to the thumb and index finger.

During a routine maintenance procedure on the conveyor belt system, employee Rodriguez was tasked with tightening loose screws on the pulley wheel. As he applied excessive force while using his wrench, it suddenly slipped out of his hand and struck him in the shoulder area, causing bruising and minor lacerations.

During a routine maintenance operation on LT 02 of the Lajes target, employee Maria Silva accidentally dropped a heavy metal wrench while attempting to loosen a bolt from its socket, causing it to fall and strike her right hand, resulting in a minor laceration requiring immediate medical attention. The incident occurred despite proper use of personal protective equipment (PPE) and adherence to standard safety protocols.

During maintenance operations on a conveyor belt in sector 3B, operator Maria encountered an obstacle while attempting to dislodge a stuck roller. As she applied force with her right hand to free the obstruction, her ring finger was pinched between the moving parts of the machinery, resulting in a minor laceration and bruising.

Employee was performing routine maintenance on a conveyor belt when their gloved hand slipped into an open gear compartment while attempting to remove debris, causing minor lacerations and bruising on fingers and wrist.

During the maintenance procedure on pump P-12, technician Carlos accidentally knocked over a container holding hydraulic fluid, causing it to spill onto the floor and slide towards him. As he tried to contain the spill, his foot slipped into an exposed electrical conduit hole (0.60m deep), resulting in minor burns and cuts.

During a routine inspection of the conveyor belt system, employee Maria was walking along the catwalk when her footing slipped on an oily surface, causing her to lose balance and fall onto the metal grating below. The impact resulted in a minor laceration above her right elbow. She was able to get up immediately after the incident with assistance from colleagues and reported no other injuries or symptoms.

While performing maintenance on a conveyor belt in the production area, an employee accidentally knocked over a toolbox while reaching for a wrench, causing it to fall onto his left foot and resulting in a 2cm laceration. The incident occurred due to the sudden movement of the tool box, which caught him off guard, leading to loss of balance and control.

Employee attempted to clear a blockage in pipe 345 using compressed air while standing nearby, but an unexpected burst of pressurized fluid struck their left shoulder and upper arm area, causing minor lacerations and bruising.

During a routine maintenance procedure on a conveyor belt system, an employee attempted to loosen a stuck bolt using a wrench while standing in close proximity to the moving machinery. As he applied force, his hand slipped and the wrench struck his left wrist against the metal frame of the conveyor belt's supporting structure, resulting in laceration injuries.

During a routine inspection at the production floor of Metaltec, employee João was examining a newly installed conveyor belt when his foot slipped on an oil spill, causing him to lose balance and fall onto the metal frame. As he tried to regain stability, his left hand came into contact with one of the moving parts, resulting in a minor laceration above the wrist. The incident occurred without any immediate medical attention being required, but João was sent home for further evaluation and treatment.

During maintenance on a conveyor belt system, an employee attempted to remove a worn-out pulley wheel by applying force to the retaining nut using a combination of hand and foot pressure. As the nut began to loosen, it suddenly came free, striking the employee's left ankle with significant force, causing bruising and swelling.

During maintenance operations on a conveyor belt system, an employee attempted to clear a blockage by using compressed air to dislodge stuck debris. Unbeknownst to them, the pressure buildup caused a nearby pipe to rupture, releasing hot oil that splashed onto their exposed skin and clothing, resulting in minor burns.

Employee was operating a conveyor belt in the packaging area when he attempted to clear a jam by hand. As he reached into the moving machinery, his gloved hand got caught between two rotating rollers, causing lacerations on the index and middle fingers of his right hand. The employee immediately stopped the machine and received medical attention at the scene.

During a routine maintenance procedure on the steam generator's blowdown valve, an operator attempted to loosen a stubborn nut using an adjustable wrench while standing at the edge of the platform overlooking the tank floor. As he applied increasing force, the nut unexpectedly broke free, causing the wrench to slip and strike his right forearm with considerable impact, resulting in lacerations and bruising. The operator was wearing safety glasses but not gloves or a hard hat during the incident.

During a routine inspection on the conveyor belt system, an operator's foot slipped off the elevated platform while checking for blockages in one of the pulleys. The sudden loss of balance caused him to fall onto the moving chain drive below, resulting in minor lacerations and bruising on his arm and shoulder from contact with metal components.

During the maintenance operation on the clarifier tank 12-01, employee José removed a section of the sludge scraper mechanism while it was still energized. As he lifted the metal plate, there was an unexpected release of hot water and solids, which splashed onto his right arm and shoulder area, causing burns and lacerations.

During the maintenance activity on a conveyor belt system, an employee was inspecting a malfunctioning pulley when his gloved hand got caught in its rotating mechanism. After struggling for several seconds, he managed to free himself but suffered minor lacerations and bruising on his palm and wrist due to the sudden release of tension.

In the Nv. 2420 - Chamber of excavation: When performing a routine inspection on the support beam structure, the worker's foot slipped on an oily spot and lost balance while descending from the catwalk at approximately 10:30 am. In an attempt to regain footing, he grasped for handhold but instead grabbed onto loose wire insulation, causing minor cuts on his right palm.

During a routine maintenance procedure on the conveyor belt system, employee Rodriguez accidentally got his hand caught in an open sprocket while attempting to clear debris from the mechanism. The incident resulted in minor lacerations and bruising on the forearm, prompting immediate first aid treatment by colleagues before evacuation to the site's medical center for further evaluation.

At approximately 8:20 a.m., during routine maintenance on level 2 of the chemical storage facility, an employee attempted to remove a loose pipe fitting from a corroded joint using a wrench and pliers. As he applied pressure, the fitting suddenly broke free and struck his left shoulder, causing bruising and minor lacerations.

During the maintenance operation on a conveyor belt in production area 3B, an employee named Rodriguez was attempting to tighten a loose screw using a wrench when his gloved hand slipped off the tool and pinched his middle finger against the moving chain of the belt. The injury caused bleeding but did not appear severe enough to require immediate medical attention; however, further evaluation by on-site personnel revealed that the pinch had damaged soft tissue in the affected area.

At approximately 02:15 p.m., in the vicinity of the storage area for flammable liquids (N° 1234), Mr. Santos, a technician from Shift B, was attempting to transfer a drum containing xylene solution to another container when he lost his footing on an uneven surface. As he struggled to regain balance, the drum slipped out of his grasp and fell onto his right foot, causing a laceration approximately 2 cm in length.

In the mechanical room of the processing plant: While performing routine maintenance on a conveyor belt, the worker was struck by flying debris when a faulty pulley system failed at 10:15 am, causing particles to ricochet off his left shoulder and arm, resulting in minor abrasions and discomfort.

Being approximately 03:15 pm on Level 1420 CX-912 BP-421 in circumstances where workers of company Atlas were performing routine maintenance on the conveyor belt system, technician Maria made an adjustment to the tensioning mechanism using a socket wrench while colleague Carlos monitored the belt's speed from the control panel. At that moment, the belt suddenly accelerated due to unsecured idler rollers, causing Maria to lose her grip and suffer injury as she attempted to regain balance with her right hand on the machine housing.

At approximately 9:20 am on level 3, in area 1234BP, operators Leonardo and Rafael were performing maintenance tasks on drilling machine XRD-50 (Hitachi). During this process, Leonardo made an adjustment to the hydraulic pump's pressure valve using a wrench while Rafael simultaneously operated the control panel. Suddenly, the valve burst due to inadequate tightening, releasing high-pressure fluid that struck Leonard in the chest area, causing injuries.

An employee was attempting to clean a clogged pipe in the processing area when he accidentally knocked over a nearby drum of lubricant, causing it to spill and slide across the floor towards him. As he tried to move out of the way, his right foot caught on an uneven surface, resulting in a deep gash on his ankle from the sharp edge of a metal plate.

During a routine maintenance operation on a conveyor belt system, collaborator Rodriguez attempted to clear a jammed pulley wheel by manually rotating it while standing beside the moving belt. As he applied force with his left hand, his ring finger became entangled in a loose screw protruding from the machinery's casing. The sudden jerking motion caused a deep laceration on the tip of his index finger and minor bruising to his palm.

While performing maintenance on a conveyor belt in sector 4, an employee attempted to dislodge a stuck bolt using a wrench and hammer combination. As he struck the wrench with moderate force, it slipped from his grasp and rebounded back into his face, striking him near the bridge of his nose.

At approximately 2:15 pm on level 1234, an employee was attempting to tighten a loose hose coupling on pump unit PX-12 using a wrench when it suddenly slipped from his grasp and struck him in the right forearm, causing lacerations requiring medical attention due to inadequate securing of the work area.

In the tunnel 12-34: While performing a routine inspection on the A40 ventilation fan at 10:15 am, the worker accidentally touched an exposed electrical wire with his gloved hand, causing a sudden spark that singed the fabric and left a small burn mark on the palm.

At approximately 9:20 a.m., in the electrical room of the Petrochem plant, an electrician was attempting to tighten a loose wire connection when his gloved hand slipped off the terminal, causing him to receive a minor burn on his left thumb and fingers from the live circuit. The injured employee immediately reported the incident to their supervisor and received first aid treatment before seeking further medical attention.

During a routine inspection of the conveyor belt's idler rollers on production line B-2, maintenance technician Maria failed to notice an exposed shaft protruding from one of the rollers. As she reached in to clear debris with her right hand, the spinning shaft struck her thumb and index finger, causing lacerations and bruising.

During maintenance operations on a steam generator's secondary superheater tube, an employee attempted to remove a bolt using an adjustable wrench while standing at a height of approximately 4 feet above ground level due to inadequate clearance for comfortable use of the floor-standing toolset. As he applied force to loosen the bolt, his right hand slipped off the handle and came into contact with the sharp edge of the tube's flange, resulting in laceration on the index finger.

During the maintenance activity on a conveyor belt, an employee's right foot slipped off a metal rung while descending from the elevated platform, resulting in a bruise and laceration on the ankle area.

While operating a conveyor belt, an employee's hand slipped into the gap between two moving rollers as he attempted to clear debris from the system. The rolling motion caused his hand to become pinched and crushed by the rotating drums, resulting in severe bruising and lacerations on the index finger and thumb.

During a routine maintenance operation on a conveyor belt system, an employee's right hand became caught in a mechanical coupling while attempting to clear debris from the machinery. The resulting injury left a deep laceration on the palm of their hand and required immediate medical attention for stitches.

At 9:20 a.m., in the chemical storage area of the Petroquímica plant, an employee attempting to move a container filled with sodium hydroxide solution (50 liters) accidentally knocked it against a metal beam, causing the contents to spill and splash onto his right arm. The caustic liquid caused first-degree burns on approximately 20% of his skin surface.

During a routine maintenance operation on a conveyor belt system, an employee accidentally dropped a wrench while attempting to tighten a loose bolt, causing it to fall onto their left hand and resulting in minor lacerations and bruising.
At approximately 10:15 a.m., in Well #12, Operator Johnson removed the pipe cleaning tool from the pipeline, causing it to fall and strike his right ankle, resulting in minor lacerations.

Employee was attempting to remove a stuck bolt from the conveyor belt's idler pulley using an open-end wrench when it slipped and struck their right hand, causing laceration on the thumb and minor bruising of the adjacent fingers.

At 02:45 p.m., in Well #12, Section C-4214, technician Maria was inspecting a faulty valve when it suddenly opened, releasing high-pressure steam onto her exposed skin, causing burns on both arms and hands.
While attempting to disconnect a hydraulic hose from the machinery, the employee's gloved hand slipped off the coupling, causing a small laceration on their index finger and minor bleeding.

While performing routine maintenance on a conveyor belt system, an employee attempted to adjust a loose screw using a wrench held in their right hand. As they applied pressure, their arm slipped and the tool came into contact with the moving chain drive, causing a minor laceration above the wrist. The injury was treated promptly by first aid responders, but the incident highlighted the importance of proper safety protocols during maintenance operations.

At approximately 9:20 am on level 2, in the course of performing a routine maintenance activity for the conveyor belt system, employee João attempted to adjust the tensioning mechanism using a torque wrench while simultaneously monitoring the belt's speed from the control panel. As he applied pressure with his right hand against the wrench handle, the belt suddenly jerked due to an unsecured pulley wheel, causing the described injury and damage to nearby equipment as a result of inadequate safety measures.

During a routine inspection of the conveyor belt's idler rollers, an employee removed one of the access panels using a wrench, but failed to secure it properly before resuming work. As they walked away from the area, the unsecured panel suddenly fell off, striking their left leg and causing minor bruising and swelling.

At 14:15 hours, in the storage area of the chemical plant, a worker attempted to lift a bundle of PVC pipes weighing approximately 25 kg., which suddenly slipped from his grasp and fell onto his right hand, causing an injury described as moderate with partial numbness and tingling. The employee was wearing all required personal protective equipment (PPE) at the time of the accident and received medical attention on site before being cleared to return to work after a short period of observation.

Employee was inspecting a faulty steam valve on the 3rd floor of the processing unit when a sudden burst of pressurized vapor escaped, striking his left shoulder and arm with moderate force, causing minor bruising and redness.

During a routine maintenance procedure on conveyor belt 3 at the processing plant, employee Rodriguez was tasked with cleaning accumulated debris from beneath the rollers. While performing this duty, he lost his footing and fell onto an exposed metal edge, sustaining lacerations on both knees and minor abrasions to his palms.

At 10:20 am on level 3, in the area where Rock company's workers were performing maintenance tasks on drilling machine Diamantina XRD-15 (Hitachi), assistant Juan made a mistake while tightening the central bolt of the drill bit using wrench No. 22. Simultaneously, his colleague Carlos from the control panel was adjusting the rotation unit to position the clamp pin for future use. As Juan's left hand slipped off the wrench due to lack of attention and proper grip, it caused the described injury, resulting in a minor laceration on the palm of his hand requiring medical assistance.

During the maintenance procedure on a conveyor belt, an employee accidentally activated the reversing mechanism while attempting to clear a jammed area, causing a loose metal plate to swing towards their left arm and strike it with moderate force, resulting in minor lacerations and bruising.

At approximately 14:20 hours in the production area of the E.E Unicon, a mechanical technician was attempting to adjust the alignment of the conveyor belt when he lost his footing on an uneven surface covered with scattered debris. As he regained balance, he accidentally dropped the wrench (1 kg.) from his right hand, which fell onto the top of his left foot, causing a minor laceration approximately 2 cm in length.

While performing routine maintenance on conveyor belt 345 at approximately 2:15 pm, technician Ana attempted to tighten a loose bolt using an adjustable wrench. As she applied pressure, the wrench slipped from her grasp and struck her left hand near the wrist area, causing lacerations due to its sharp edge. The incident occurred in the absence of proper personal protective equipment (PPE) for the task at hand.

During a routine maintenance procedure on conveyor belt 3, an employee attempted to loosen a stuck bolt using a breaker bar while standing near the drive motor. As the bolt suddenly released, it struck the employee's left knee, causing bruising and swelling in that area. The incident occurred at approximately 10:45 AM local time.

During a routine inspection of the conveyor belt system in the processing area at 10:30 am, technician Maria was examining a faulty pulley when she accidentally stepped onto an exposed electrical conduit, which caused her right foot to slip into the narrow gap between two metal plates (0.50m wide). She managed to free herself without serious injury after approximately 15 minutes of struggling.

During a routine maintenance procedure on the A-12 conveyor belt system, employee Carlos inadvertently activated the chain tensioner while attempting to loosen a stuck sprocket. The sudden release of stored energy caused him to lose balance and strike his knee against the metal frame, resulting in bruising and minor lacerations.

During a routine maintenance procedure on a conveyor belt system at approximately 2:15 pm, an operator attempted to loosen a stuck roller using a hydraulic wrench while standing directly behind it. As he applied force, the wrench suddenly released, causing the rolling mechanism to swing back and strike the operator's right shoulder and upper arm with moderate force.

During maintenance operations on a heat exchanger, an employee attempted to loosen a stuck valve using a breaker bar while standing at the top of a 3-meter-high platform ladder. As he applied force, his gloved hand slipped and came into contact with the hot surface of the unit, causing second-degree burns on the palm area. The incident occurred in a confined space with limited visibility, making it difficult for colleagues to provide immediate assistance.
At approximately 10:15 a.m., in Well #12, Operator Johnson removed the pipe cleaning tool from the pipeline, causing it to fall and strike his right ankle, resulting in minor lacerations.

During maintenance on a conveyor belt system, an employee attempted to remove a stuck pulley wheel by applying force with a crowbar while standing in close proximity to the moving rollers. As the wheel began to loosen, it swung back and struck the employee's left forearm, causing minor lacerations and bruising.

At 14:27 hours in the storage area of the chemical plant, a forklift operator attempted to move a pallet while wearing required personal protective equipment (PPE). As he navigated around a corner, his foot slipped off the pedal and struck the edge of a metal beam, causing a laceration on the top of his left hand. The employee was treated at the on-site medical facility before returning to work after a brief absence.

During the maintenance activity on a conveyor belt system, an employee was inspecting a malfunctioning pulley when his gloved hand got caught in its rotating mechanism. After struggling for several seconds, he managed to free himself but suffered minor lacerations and bruising on his palm and wrist due to the sudden release of tension.

At 14:30 hours on Level 3, in the vicinity of Unit 1245-BP-2199, a mechanical failure occurred during routine maintenance operations. Technician Maria was attempting to secure the locking mechanism on the hydraulic press using wrench No. 12 while simultaneously checking the pressure gauge with her right hand. As she tightened the bolt, the frame suddenly shifted due to an unsecured connection between the piston and cylinder head, causing a sudden release of stored energy that struck Maria's left arm, resulting in minor bruising and lacerations.

At 8:20 a.m., in the storage area of the chemical plant, an operator accidentally knocked over a stack of empty containers (5 kg each) while attempting to retrieve a nearby item from the shelf. One container fell onto the toe of their right foot, causing bruising and discomfort.

During a routine maintenance procedure on one of the production lines at the chemical plant, an employee accidentally knocked over a container filled with abrasive powder while trying to access a hard-to-reach area. The contents spilled onto the floor and created a slippery surface. As he attempted to clean up the mess, his left foot slipped into the powdery substance and lost traction, causing him to fall backward against a nearby metal beam. He suffered minor injuries to his back and elbow from the impact.

During a routine maintenance operation on a conveyor belt system, an employee attempted to loosen a stuck pulley wheel by applying excessive force using a hydraulic wrench. As the bolt suddenly released, it struck the worker's left wrist, causing bruising and swelling.

During a routine maintenance procedure on a conveyor belt system, an employee's gloved hand slipped off the moving part while attempting to tighten a loose screw using a wrench. The sudden loss of control caused the employee to lose their balance and stumble backward, striking their left shoulder against a nearby metal beam.

At 08:45 a.m., in the NV-3456 area, operator Maria removed a loose bolt from the conveyor belt's idler wheel using pliers. As she lifted her hand away, the bolt rolled off and fell onto the exposed electrical conduit, causing an arc flash that singed the tip of her right index finger and left it with minor burns.

On Level 2300 Cx 012 BP 532, at approximately 4:15 pm, during the installation of a ventilation duct on the roof of Building A, worker Antonio was using an electric screwdriver with his right hand while holding onto the scaffolding railing with his left hand. As he tightened the last screw, his grip slipped and the screwdriver fell to the ground, causing it to make contact with a live electrical cable nearby. The resulting spark ignited the nearby flammable materials, engulfing Antonio's sleeve in flames. He suffered minor burns on his forearm before coworkers quickly extinguished the fire using an emergency response kit.

At 8:20 a.m., in the storage area of the chemical plant, an operator accidentally knocked over a drum (50 kg.) containing sodium hydroxide solution while attempting to move it with a pallet jack. The spilled liquid flowed onto the floor and came into contact with the exposed skin on his left forearm, causing irritation and minor burns.

During maintenance operations on a conveyor belt system at approximately 2:15 pm, employee Maria attempted to tighten a loose bolt using a wrench while standing near the moving belt. As she applied pressure with her right hand, the wrench slipped from her grasp and fell onto the belt, causing it to become entangled in the machinery's rotating components. The sudden stop of the belt resulted in a loud noise, startling employee Carlos nearby, who instinctively reacted by reaching out to grab his falling toolbox. Unfortunately, Maria was struck on the left temple by the swinging tool handle, resulting in a minor laceration and bruising.

During a routine maintenance operation on a conveyor belt system, an employee's gloved hand slipped from the ladder rung while descending, causing their wrist to strike against a metal bracket protruding from the machinery, resulting in contusion and bruising at the affected area.

During maintenance operations on a conveyor belt system, an employee's gloved hand got caught in a pinch point between two rollers while attempting to clear a jammed material blockage. The sudden movement of the rollers caused the glove to tear and lacerate the employee's finger, resulting in bleeding and minor tissue damage.

During a routine maintenance check on the conveyor belt system at the processing plant, employee Patel was instructed to clear a jammed section by manually rotating the stuck rollers with his gloved hand. As he turned one of the rollers, his right wrist came into contact with the sharp edge of another roller that had not been properly aligned during installation, causing a deep laceration on the outer aspect of his forearm.

During maintenance operations on a conveyor belt system, an employee was tasked with replacing a worn-out idler pulley bearing (part number 1234-5678). While loosening the retaining bolts, a sudden release of tension caused the drive shaft to swing back and forth, striking the worker's right forearm near the wrist.

While performing maintenance on a conveyor belt system, an employee was attempting to tighten a loose bolt using a wrench when their footing slipped on a patch of oil on the floor. As they struggled to regain balance, the wrench flew out of their hand and struck their left forearm just above the wrist, causing a minor laceration approximately 2cm in length.

During maintenance operations on a conveyor belt system, an employee's gloved hand slipped into a rotating pulley while cleaning debris from the machinery. The sudden rotation of the pulley caused friction burns and lacerations on the exposed skin between the glove cuff and wristband. Medical attention was sought immediately to treat the minor injuries.

During a routine maintenance procedure on conveyor belt 3, Mr. Rodriguez accidentally dropped his toolbox from waist level onto his right foot while trying to free it from between two stationary rollers. The impact caused bruising and swelling in the ankle area.

During the replacement of a worn-out conveyor belt in production area 3, an employee was attempting to loosen the bolt securing the old belt's tensioning system while another worker provided manual support for the moving rollers. As they applied force with a combination wrench, the bolt suddenly released its grip on the frame, striking the index finger of the assisting employee and causing a minor laceration.

During a routine maintenance procedure on a conveyor belt system, an employee attempted to loosen a stubborn bolt using a wrench while standing at the edge of the production floor. As he applied excessive force, the wrench slipped from his grasp and fell onto the nearby control panel, causing it to malfunction. The sudden jolt sent the employee stumbling backward, whereupon they lost their balance and fell against a stationary metal beam, which struck their left elbow with sufficient force to cause injury.

During a routine maintenance check on LT 02 of the Lajes target, Engineer Patel accidentally dropped her toolbox from approximately two meters height onto her left hand, causing minor bruising and swelling. At the time of the incident, she was wearing all required personal protective equipment (PPE) for the task. The employee received medical attention at the site's first aid station and returned to work after a brief period of observation.

At approximately 9:20 am on the production floor, operator Maria was tasked with replacing a faulty motor in the packaging machine. As she reached for the replacement part, her colleague Juan accidentally released the tension on the overhead conveyor belt, causing it to swing back and forth wildly. The loose belt struck Maria's shoulder, resulting in minor injuries due to inadequate safety measures and lack of communication among team members during equipment maintenance operations.

During the removal of a stuck valve stem in well 3, an employee used pliers to apply force on the frozen fitting when it suddenly released, striking their right elbow against the surrounding metal casing.

During maintenance operations on a conveyor belt, an employee attempted to remove a stuck screw using pliers while standing at a height of approximately 2 meters above ground level. As they applied pressure, the screw unexpectedly broke free and fell towards their chest, striking them with moderate force before landing on the floor. The impact caused bruising and minor lacerations to the individual's left side.

During a routine maintenance check on the conveyor belt system, an employee's gloved hand slipped off the worn-out handle of the motorized pulley, causing their index finger to become pinched between the moving parts and the stationary frame, resulting in partial amputation at the proximal phalanx.

During a routine maintenance operation on conveyor belt 3 at the processing plant, an employee slipped on a grease spill and fell onto a metal rod protruding from the machinery, causing minor lacerations on their left hand and forearm. The injured worker was treated by first aid responders and returned to work after a short period of observation.

Employee was attempting to replace a faulty pressure gauge on the processing unit when it suddenly released its contents onto their arm, causing minor lacerations and burns from the hot fluid flow. The employee quickly moved away but not before some of the substance splashed onto their leg, resulting in localized skin irritation.

During a routine maintenance operation on the conveyor belt system at the production facility, an employee attempted to loosen a stuck gear using an adjustable wrench while standing on a raised platform. As he applied force to turn the gear, his foot slipped off the edge of the platform and he fell approximately 4 feet onto the concrete floor below, landing awkwardly on his outstretched right arm. The impact caused a sharp pain in his wrist and elbow regions, prompting him to seek medical attention from the facility's first aid station.

During a routine maintenance operation at the processing plant, an operator attempted to loosen a corroded bolt on a mechanical arm using a wrench while standing on a catwalk above the production floor. The bolt suddenly gave way, causing the arm to swing freely and strike the operator's left shoulder with considerable force, resulting in injury due to the impact and subsequent fall from the catwalk.

In the Nv. 1412 - Concrete mixer area: During the loading process, an employee was standing near the hopper when a sudden release of cement powder caused him to inhale a large amount of dust, leading to coughing and difficulty breathing. Despite wearing his respirator mask, he removed it briefly to clear his throat, allowing some of the fine particles to enter his left eye, causing irritation and temporary vision impairment.

During a routine maintenance procedure on the conveyor belt system in Sector 3, employee Rodriguez inadvertently touched a live electrical wire while attempting to clear debris from the machinery's underside. The jolt of electricity caused his right hand to contract involuntarily, causing him to drop the wrench he was holding onto the metal floor plate below.

During a routine maintenance operation on a conveyor belt system, operator Rodriguez failed to secure a loose screw on her safety glove, which came undone and got caught in the machinery's moving parts as she was checking its alignment. The sudden jerk caused minor lacerations on her left hand, prompting an immediate evacuation to the site's first-aid station for treatment and further evaluation.

At approximately 9:15 a.m., during routine maintenance on LT-03 at the E.E Unicon site, an incident occurred when technician João Silva attempted to remove a stuck bolt from the Mixkret 111 fuel tank using a hammer and chisel. As he struck the bolt with force, it suddenly broke free, causing the metal fragment to ricochet off the surrounding equipment and strike the employee's left hand, resulting in a deep laceration requiring medical attention at the on-site clinic for further treatment.

During the replacement of a worn-out belt on conveyor 3B, the operator attempted to lift one end while standing directly underneath it, unaware that another section was still moving under tension. The sudden release caused the remaining length to whip around and strike him across the chest and shoulder area with moderate force.

During a routine maintenance operation on the conveyor belt system, employee João suffered a minor laceration when his gloved hand came into contact with an exposed gear shaft while attempting to tighten a loose bolt. The injury required basic first aid and resulted in a short absence from work for medical evaluation before being cleared to resume duties the following day.

During a routine maintenance procedure on a chemical processing unit, an employee's gloved hand slipped off the coupling nut while tightening it, causing his ring finger to be pinched between the metal and concrete floor of the walkway. The resulting crush injury was severe enough to warrant immediate medical attention.

During a routine inspection of the conveyor belt system on level 214 GTS, an employee accidentally slipped while walking along the catwalk and fell onto the metal grating, which was wet from recent cleaning activities. The fall caused bruising on their left shoulder and elbow.

When attempting to replace a faulty light fixture in the warehouse's ceiling grid system, the employee misjudged the distance between two suspended beams and lost his balance while reaching for it. As he grasped at thin air, his right hand slipped from the beam and struck against an exposed metal strut, causing a 2-centimeter laceration on the palmar surface of his index finger.

During the maintenance operation on a conveyor belt in the production area, an employee attempted to clear a blockage by inserting his right hand into the gap between two rollers while wearing insulated gloves. As he pressed against the obstruction with moderate force, a sudden release of compressed air from the adjacent pneumatic cylinder caused his gloved hand to be rapidly withdrawn and struck against the nearby metal frame, resulting in minor bruising on the thumb and index finger.

During a routine inspection of the conveyor belt system, Mr. Rodriguez noticed an unusual vibration in one section. While attempting to adjust the tensioning mechanism, his gloved hand slipped and got caught between two moving rollers, causing minor lacerations on the palm and fingers of his left hand. The incident was quickly brought under control by colleagues who stopped the machinery and provided first aid assistance.

Employee attempted to clear a jammed conveyor belt by using a metal rod to dislodge stuck material at the machine's discharge point, but as they applied force, the rod suddenly slipped and struck their left wrist against the exposed gear shaft, causing minor lacerations and bruising.

Employee reports that while operating a mechanical arm in the chemical processing area, he was struck by falling pipes filled with viscous liquid, which splashed onto his left shoulder and upper back. The impact caused minor burns and bruising, but no permanent injuries were sustained.

During a routine maintenance check on conveyor belt 12 at the processing plant, technician Carlos was accessing the elevated walkway when his foot slipped on an oily patch, causing him to lose balance and tumble onto the metal grating below. As he tried to regain footing, his hard hat fell off, striking his left temple with moderate force, resulting in a minor laceration approximately 2 cm long.

Employee attempted to tighten a loose bolt on the conveyor belt's idler pulley using an adjustable wrench while standing on the raised platform of the motorized cart, which was not properly secured. The wrench slipped from his grasp and struck the metal frame of the cart, causing it to swing violently towards him, resulting in minor lacerations on his left hand and wrist area.

During a routine maintenance operation on a conveyor belt system, an employee's gloved hand slipped off the railing while attempting to clean a stubborn jammed object from beneath the moving belt, resulting in a deep laceration across the palmar surface of their right index finger.

During a routine maintenance procedure on level 3 of the processing unit at approximately 2:15 am, assistant Javier was tasked with replacing a faulty sensor on conveyor belt C-123. As he reached for the replacement part, his gloved hand slipped due to excessive oil residue on the surface, causing him to lose balance and drop the tool onto his left foot. The impact resulted in a deep laceration requiring immediate medical attention.

During maintenance operations on a conveyor belt system, an employee attempted to remove a stuck pulley wheel by applying force to it using a hammer and screwdriver combination tool. As he did so, his gloved hand slipped off the handle of the screwdriver, causing him to accidentally strike the ring finger of his left hand against the metal frame of the machine's housing.

During the maintenance activity on a storage tank, an employee attempted to loosen a stuck valve handle by applying excessive force with his left hand, causing it to suddenly rotate and strike his ring finger against the metal edge of the nearby pipe support bracket, resulting in laceration injuries.

During maintenance operations on a steam pipe, an employee's gloved hand slipped off the flanged joint as he was tightening it using a wrench, resulting in his finger being pinched by the moving part and causing injury.

At 2:15 p.m., in Bay 3 of Plant A, Mr. Patel was tasked with tightening a loose bolt on a conveyor belt's metal frame using a wrench while standing on a raised platform. As he applied force, the bolt suddenly broke free and swung back towards him, striking his left shoulder and causing bruising.

While performing maintenance on a conveyor belt system, an employee attempted to remove a stuck pulley wheel by applying manual force against it. The sudden release of tension caused the wheel to swing back and strike the worker's left forearm with considerable force, resulting in injury.

Employee was adjusting a loose bolt on a conveyor belt pulley when it suddenly came free, striking his left wrist against the metal frame of the machine, causing bruising and swelling in the affected area.

At approximately 14:45 hours on LT-02 of the Lajes target, Senior Technician Fernandes suffered a minor injury when he accidentally dropped a metal wrench from a height of about 1 meter and it landed on his left forearm, causing a shallow laceration that required minimal medical attention. The employee was treated at the site's first aid station and returned to work after receiving basic care.

During a routine inspection in the storage area, employee Maria encountered an uneven floor surface while navigating between stacked crates. As she adjusted her footing, her right hand grasped for balance and inadvertently knocked against a loose pipe coupling, causing minor cuts on her index finger. The incident was reported to management and treated promptly by first aid personnel.

During maintenance operations on a conveyor belt system, an employee's gloved hand became entangled in a rotating pulley wheel while attempting to remove debris from its surface. The sudden jerk caused by the rotation of the wheel resulted in a deep laceration to the employee's forearm and wrist area.

At 14:20 hours in the chemical storage area of Petroquímica S.A., two warehouse workers, Paulo and Luana, were moving a 25 kg drum of hydrochloric acid to a designated storage location. As they attempted to lift it together, the drum slipped from their grasp and fell onto Paulo's right hand, causing lacerations and bruising due to its sharp edges.

During the replacement of a conveyor belt pulley wheel, an employee used a pry bar to loosen the retaining clips on the side plate. As they applied force, the bar suddenly slipped and struck their right ankle, causing bruising and swelling at the point of impact.

At 08:45 a.m., in Bay 3 of the production area, maintenance worker Jameson adjusted the conveyor belt's tensioning system by releasing the locking mechanism and manually turning the adjustment screw while holding onto the adjacent structural frame with his left hand. As he applied additional pressure to tighten the belt, the released mechanism suddenly rebounded, causing a metal plate to swing back towards him at high speed, striking the outer edge of Jameson's right forearm near the wrist area, resulting in minor lacerations and bruising.

During a routine inspection in the storage area, an employee notices a weak link on one end of a suspended chain used for lifting heavy machinery parts. Without proper authorization, he decides to cut it off using bolt cutters while standing nearby. Suddenly, the severed section falls from 3 meters above and hits him on the right shoulder, causing minor bruising but no major injuries.

When attempting to inspect a malfunctioning conveyor belt pulley 14A on the second floor of the facility's storage area, the maintenance worker inadvertently triggered an unexpected release of compressed air from the adjacent pressurized pipe system. The sudden pressure drop caused a nearby stack of metal drums to topple over, with one drum weighing approximately 50 kilograms falling onto the worker's right shoulder and arm, resulting in contusions and lacerations.

In the area near the concrete mixer, a worker was adjusting the mixing arm when it suddenly dislodged from its socket due to worn-out bearings. The loose arm swung around and struck the worker's left shoulder, causing an injury. A colleague nearby heard the noise and rushed to assist but slipped on spilled cement, adding to the chaos.

During a routine maintenance procedure on a conveyor belt system, an employee attempted to loosen a stubborn bolt using a wrench. In the process, the tool slipped from his grasp and struck the employee's left index finger, causing laceration and bleeding. The injured party was immediately attended to by colleagues and evacuated to the site's first aid station for further treatment.

In the maintenance pit 14-02: When performing a routine inspection on the electrical panel, the worker's gloved hand accidentally touched an exposed live wire at 9:15 am, causing a sudden and intense electric shock that left his right palm numb for several minutes. Despite feeling discomfort, he continued to inspect other panels without reporting the incident or seeking medical attention until 11:30 am when he finally decided to report it to their supervisor due to persistent pain in his hand.

During a routine maintenance operation on level 14 GTS, an assistant accidentally knocked over a toolbox while reaching for a wrench, causing it to roll towards him and strike his left ankle with moderate force, resulting in a bruise and swelling.

During maintenance operations in the storage area, a pallet jack's tire suddenly burst while being lifted by an employee, causing one of its steel rim fragments to strike his left ankle at approximately 90 degrees, resulting in minor lacerations and bruising.

During a routine maintenance operation on a conveyor belt system, an employee was attempting to loosen a stubborn bolt using a breaker bar when it suddenly slipped out of his grasp and struck him in the left wrist, causing injury due to its sharp edge and considerable force.

During maintenance operations on a conveyor belt at 14:30 pm, an employee slipped while walking backwards along the side of the moving belt and fell onto a metal plate protruding from the floor, resulting in bruising on his left hip. The accident occurred due to inadequate lighting conditions in the area.

While performing maintenance on a conveyor belt in the production area, an employee accidentally kicked over a bucket filled with small metal parts, causing them to scatter across the floor. As he attempted to clean up the mess, his foot slipped on one of the loose pieces and twisted awkwardly, resulting in a minor laceration above the ankle requiring minimal medical attention.

During a routine maintenance procedure at the oil refinery's storage tank 12, technician Maria Sousa suffered an accidental cut on her left hand while attempting to remove a loose bolt from a valve cover using a wrench. The incident occurred when the bolt suddenly released and struck her hand, causing a shallow laceration that required immediate medical attention. Despite wearing personal protective equipment (PPE), including gloves, at the time of the accident, Maria's wrist was exposed due to an improperly secured glove strap. She received treatment on-site before being transported to a nearby hospital for further evaluation and stitches.

At approximately 2:15 p.m., in the storage area of the E.E. Unicon's production facility, maintenance worker Carlos was attempting to retrieve a loose pipe wrench from its hook when his foot slipped on an oil spill, causing him to lose balance and fall onto the sharp edge of an open toolbox. The impact resulted in a 2cm laceration above his right anklebone.

During a routine inspection at the chemical storage facility, an operator attempted to remove a valve cap on tank 12B while it was still under partial pressure. As he lifted the cap, a small amount of caustic liquid splashed onto his right forearm and elbow area, causing minor burns and irritation. The incident occurred in a designated maintenance zone with proper personal protective equipment (PPE) worn by the operator at all times.

During routine maintenance on a mechanical press at LT 02, an employee accidentally released the locking mechanism while adjusting the machine's pivot arm, causing it to swing back and strike their left shoulder with moderate force. The worker was wearing all required personal protective equipment (PPE) and immediately reported the incident for medical attention. After receiving treatment, they returned to work the following day without any long-term effects from the accident.

During a routine maintenance check on the conveyor belt system in the production hall, employee Ribeiro attempted to adjust a loose screw using his right hand while holding onto the rail with his left. As he shifted his position, his grip weakened and he lost balance, causing him to fall towards the moving belt. His arm got caught between two rollers, resulting in minor bruising on his forearm and elbow area.

During maintenance operations on LT 02 of the Lajes target, a technician accidentally touched an exposed electrical conductor while reaching for his toolbox, causing a minor shock and superficial burns on the index finger of their left hand. The incident occurred despite wearing all required personal protective equipment (PPE) at the time. After receiving medical attention at the site's first aid station, the employee was cleared to return to work with minimal restrictions following a brief observation period.

At 9:20 a.m., in the warehouse area of the Fertilizantes del Pacifico plant, an incident occurred when two workers were attempting to lift a stack of crates weighing approximately 40 kg each using a forklift with a damaged tire. As they struggled to maneuver the load, one of the crates shifted and fell from the pallet, striking the worker's right ankle causing a laceration.

On January 10th at approximately 1:15 pm on level 2100 Cx 012 BP 542, while performing maintenance tasks on drilling machine Diamantina XRD-25 (Hitachi), employee Maria attempted to tighten the hydraulic hose using a wrench when it suddenly slipped from her grasp and struck her right thumb against the metal frame of the machine.

During maintenance operations on a pulp processing system, an operator attempted to disconnect a flexible hose connecting the tank outlet valve to the pump discharge pipe. As he loosened the fitting, pressurized pulp suddenly released from the system and splashed onto his right arm, causing bruising and minor lacerations. The incident occurred while both pumps were offline for routine maintenance, and the operator was wearing safety gloves but not a face shield at the time of the accident.

At approximately 11:20 a.m., during routine maintenance on the production line at E.S. Mfg., an employee attempted to tighten a loose bolt using an adjustable wrench, but lost grip and accidentally dropped it onto their right index finger, causing a laceration requiring medical attention.

In the storage area of raw materials at 11:20 a.m., an employee attempted to move a pallet loaded with metal rods, weighing approximately 50 kg, using a manual dolly. As he pushed it across the floor, the dolly's wheel suddenly broke, causing the pallet to tilt and one rod to fall onto his right hand, resulting in lacerations on the palmar surface.

During maintenance operations on conveyor belt N° 14 at 10:30 a.m., an employee accidentally activated the inverter control panel, causing sudden acceleration of the moving parts while attempting to adjust the tensioner pulley. As he tried to withdraw his hand from the danger zone, it got caught between the rotating drum and the stationary frame, resulting in minor lacerations on the index finger.

While performing maintenance on a conveyor belt system, an employee accidentally dropped a wrench onto their foot when it slipped from grasp while attempting to loosen a bolt, resulting in minor injuries and temporary discomfort.

During a routine inspection, an operator attempted to remove a loose screw from the conveyor belt's drive motor housing. As they pried open the cover plate, a falling metal rod struck their left temple and wrist, causing minor lacerations and bruising. The operator was wearing safety glasses at the time of the incident but failed to use proper personal protective equipment (PPE) for the task.

During a routine maintenance operation on the conveyor belt system, employee Carlos attempted to loosen a stuck pulley wheel using an open-end wrench. As he applied force, the wrench slipped and struck his right wrist, causing lacerations from the metal edge of the tool. The incident occurred when Carlos was not wearing proper personal protective equipment (PPE).

At approximately 3:20 pm on level 2, in a situation where workers from company Terra performed routine maintenance tasks on drilling machine Atlas XRD-50 (Hitachi), assistant Ana made adjustments to the central bolt with an adjustable wrench No. 14 while simultaneously operator Carlos controlled the rotation unit for positioning of the clamp pin at the drill head. Suddenly, the frame slid due to Ana's thumb pressing against the wrench handle, causing injury and damage to surrounding equipment as a result of inadequate securing of the frame fixing bolts.

Employee was attempting to replace a faulty sensor on the conveyor belt when their gloved hand slipped off the tooling plate, causing them to lose control of the equipment. The spinning machinery kicked back and struck the employee's shoulder, resulting in bruising and minor lacerations.

An employee was attempting to tighten a loose screw on the conveyor belt's motor housing using an adjustable wrench when it slipped off, striking their right ring finger against the metal surface and causing minor lacerations and bruising at the affected area.

Employee reports being in close proximity to a malfunctioning conveyor belt when a loose screw flew off and struck his left shoulder, causing minor bruising and discomfort. The incident occurred during routine maintenance operations at the packaging area of the facility.
Employee reports being struck by a falling metal pipe while attempting to secure it on the upper level of tank 14 in the processing area, resulting in minor lacerations on his left hand and wrist.

During a routine maintenance operation on the conveyor belt system at approximately 14:15 pm, collaborator Lucia was adjusting the tension of the drive chain when her gloved hand slipped and she accidentally dropped a screwdriver into an open gear housing, which is located about 0.75 meters below ground level. The screwdriver fell to the bottom of the housing without causing any immediate harm or damage.

During a routine maintenance operation on a chemical processing unit, an employee accidentally knocked over a container holding a mixture of chemicals while trying to access a hard-to-reach area. The spilled liquid came into contact with his left arm, causing moderate burns and discomfort. Despite immediate attention from colleagues, the injured worker was evacuated for further medical treatment at the site's infirmary.

During a routine maintenance procedure on the 345-Alpha drilling rig, technician Leonardo accidentally struck his left wrist against the exposed pipe coupling while attempting to loosen it with a wrench. The impact caused bruising and swelling in the affected area, requiring immediate medical attention from the site's first aid team before being transported to NATCLAR for further treatment.

While attempting to clear a clogged pipe in the production area, Mr. Patel's gloved hand became wedged between the pipe and its adjacent support bracket as he tried to rotate it for dislodging the obstruction. The resulting pressure caused minor lacerations on his thumb and index finger of the left hand.

Employee was conducting a routine inspection on the conveyor belt in the processing area when they lost their footing due to uneven flooring and fell onto the moving machinery, resulting in minor cuts on both hands from jagged metal edges.

At approximately 8:20 am on level 3, in circumstances where workers from company ABC were performing maintenance tasks on a conveyor belt system, operator Maria attempted to adjust the tensioning mechanism using a wrench while simultaneously monitoring the control panel's display for the nearby packaging machine. As she applied pressure with her right hand against the wrench handle, the loose bolt suddenly gave way, causing the metal plate to swing back and strike her left shoulder, resulting in injury due to inadequate securing of fasteners during maintenance procedures.

While performing routine maintenance on a conveyor belt system at the processing facility, an operator's gloved hand became entangled in the moving chain links as he attempted to clear debris from the track. The sudden jerk of the chain caused lacerations and bruising to his hand, requiring immediate medical attention.

Employee was performing maintenance on a hydraulic pump at the production facility when they accidentally dropped a wrench down into the oil reservoir while attempting to loosen a stuck bolt. The tool fell approximately 10 feet, striking the employee's left shoulder and causing minor bruising and discomfort.

During maintenance operations on a conveyor belt system, an employee's gloved hand became entangled in a loose wire mesh attached to the moving chain. As they attempted to free their hand, the chain reversed direction due to mechanical failure, causing a sudden and unexpected jerk that resulted in lacerations on the wrist area.

During routine maintenance on a conveyor belt system at the processing plant, an employee attempted to loosen a stubborn bolt using a breaker bar and socket wrench combination tool. As he applied additional force, the bolt unexpectedly broke free, striking his right forearm with sufficient impact to cause bruising and lacerations. The worker was wearing required personal protective equipment (PPE) during the incident but did not require hospitalization or extended time off work for recovery.
During maintenance operations on a conveyor belt, an employee's sleeve got caught in a moving pulley system, causing a laceration and bruising on their wrist.

During a routine maintenance operation on the conveyor belt system at the processing plant, an employee experienced a mechanical failure while attempting to adjust a faulty pulley wheel. The sudden release of tension caused by the malfunction resulted in the wheel's loose chain flying off and striking the worker's left forearm with moderate force, causing bruising and swelling in that area.

In the vicinity of the coal storage area, a worker was inspecting a mechanical conveyor belt when an unexpected failure occurred in one of its rollers. A piece of metal approximately 10 cm long and 2 mm thick broke off from the roller and fell onto the walkway, striking the worker's hand and causing minor lacerations. The incident happened during regular maintenance operations with no hazardous materials involved.

During a routine maintenance check on LT 02 of the Lajes target, Senior technician Carlos Silva accidentally touched an exposed electrical wire while navigating through the confined space, causing a minor shock and superficial burns on his left hand. At the time of the accident, the employee was wearing all required personal protective equipment (PPE) and had followed established safety protocols. The incident was reported to management, and medical attention was sought; Carlos returned to work after a day's recuperation with no lasting effects.

During a routine maintenance procedure on a conveyor belt system, an employee attempted to loosen a stuck pulley wheel by applying excessive force with a wrench, causing it to suddenly release and swing back towards him. The employee's hand was caught in the moving mechanism, resulting in lacerations requiring medical attention.

During a routine inspection of a conveyor belt system, an employee's sleeve became entangled in a moving pulley wheel while reaching for a loose screw on the adjacent section. The sudden jerk caused by the entanglement resulted in a minor abrasion on the upper arm and bruising to the elbow area.

During maintenance operations on a heat exchanger in the processing area, an employee was struck by a falling metal panel when it suddenly detached from its mounting bracket due to excessive vibration caused by inadequate fastening of the securing screws. The panel, weighing approximately 25 kg, fell from a height of about 2 meters and hit the worker's left shoulder and arm with moderate force, causing bruising and minor lacerations.

During the maintenance operation on a conveyor belt in area 3B-12, an employee's safety glasses were broken by falling debris from a malfunctioning pulley system, resulting in a minor eye injury with no loss of vision.

Employee reports a minor injury while performing maintenance on a heat exchanger in the processing area. During the inspection of the unit's exterior, he was splashed with a small amount of hot oil from an open drain valve that had not been properly secured by his colleague. The employee felt a brief burning sensation on their left hand and arm before quickly washing off the spill with water.

During a routine maintenance procedure on a conveyor belt system in the production area, employee João accidentally touched an exposed electrical conduit while attempting to clear debris from the machinery's underside. The sudden jolt caused him to lose his balance and fall onto his left hip, resulting in bruising and discomfort.

During a routine maintenance operation on conveyor belt 12, collaborator Rodriguez attempts to adjust the tensioning system while standing between two rollers. As he reaches for the adjustment lever with his right hand, his left foot slips off the metal platform and partially falls into an open gap (0.75m deep) in the floor, causing a minor laceration on his ankle. The belt was not operational at the time of the incident, but it had been recently lubricated.

During the maintenance activity on conveyor belt 3A, employee Carlos Silva was removing a faulty gear when it suddenly broke loose, causing him to be struck by flying debris and resulting in lacerations on his left arm. Despite wearing required personal protective equipment (PPE), he sustained minor injuries that were treated at the site's first aid station before being cleared to return to work after a short period of observation.

During maintenance operations on a conveyor belt system, an employee attempted to remove a stuck roller using a pry bar. As they applied pressure, the roller suddenly shifted and struck their left wrist against the metal frame of the machinery, resulting in injury.

While attempting to clear a clogged pipe in the production area, an employee used a wrench to loosen a stuck valve handle. However, as they applied force, the handle suddenly gave way and struck their elbow against the adjacent machinery, causing bruising and discomfort. The incident occurred during routine maintenance operations when other employees were present but not directly involved.

During maintenance operations on a conveyor belt at the processing plant of Minimetal, an incident occurred when the technician attempted to loosen a stuck bolt using a wrench and pliers combination tool. As he applied additional force, the wrench slipped from his grasp, causing it to strike him in the left temple area with sufficient impact to cause bruising and laceration.
