During a routine maintenance operation on the conveyor belt system at 14:15 hours, technician Juan attempted to adjust the tension of the drive pulley using a wrench while his colleague, Maria, was operating the control panel for the adjacent section. As they worked in tandem, the pulley suddenly released its grip due to an unsecured bolt, causing it to swing freely and strike Juan's left index finger with considerable force, resulting in injury.

During a maintenance operation on conveyor belt 14 at the processing plant, an employee attempted to remove a stubborn bolt from the drive pulley using a breaker bar and socket wrench. As he applied extra force, the tool slipped out of his grasp and struck him in the upper left arm near the shoulder joint, causing bruising and lacerations.

During the maintenance operation on a conveyor belt system, an employee's hand came into contact with a moving pulley wheel while attempting to clear a blockage. The impact caused bruising and lacerations on the affected limb, requiring medical attention for further treatment.

During a routine maintenance procedure on a storage tank, an employee's gloved hand slipped off the rung of a ladder while reaching for a nearby tool, causing their wrist and forearm to come into contact with the rough concrete surface beneath. The impact resulted in minor lacerations and bruising but did not require immediate medical attention.

During a routine maintenance procedure on the steam generator's blowdown valve, an employee accidentally touched a hot surface while attempting to adjust the valve stem, resulting in second-degree burns on his left hand and wrist. The incident occurred due to inadequate personal protective equipment (PPE) being worn at the time of the accident.

During a routine maintenance operation on one of the conveyor belts at the processing plant, worker Javier is tasked by his supervisor, Alejandro, to inspect and clean out a blockage in the belt's return roller system. As he accesses the area, he notices that the pulley wheel is slightly loose due to wear and tear. Without proper safety equipment or clearance from management, Javier decides to tighten the wheel himself using an adjustable wrench. However, as he applies pressure on the tool, it slips out of his hand and gets caught in a gap between the belt's steel frame and the roller housing, resulting in severe lacerations on his right palm. The supervisor rushes to assist him, but not before Javier manages to free himself from the entrapment with some difficulty.

During a maintenance operation in Stop 1234, Level 4200, worker Carlos was inspecting a damaged conveyor belt when he lost his footing on an oily surface and fell onto the moving rollers. His hand became trapped between the rollers as they continued to rotate at high speed. After being freed by colleagues with minimal delay, Carlos suffered lacerations and bruising on his left forearm but did not require hospitalization for further treatment.

During a routine inspection on conveyor belt 3, an employee was checking for blockages when his gloved hand became entangled in a loose screw on the drive motor's protective cover. As he attempted to free himself, the motor suddenly started rotating, causing the screw to tighten around his wrist and restricting blood flow. The injured worker was quickly freed by colleagues but suffered minor lacerations and bruising.

During the replacement of a faulty conveyor belt on a production line, two technicians were working at heights using aerial lifts. While attempting to reposition a heavy metal frame weighing approximately 150 kg, one technician's right hand slipped from its grip and became pinched between the frame's edge and the lift platform. The resulting injury caused bruising and swelling on the index finger of his right hand, but no fracture was reported at the time of the accident. Both technicians were wearing standard safety gloves with a non-slip coating.

During a routine maintenance operation on a conveyor belt system, an employee named Jorge was tasked by his supervisor, Carlos, to replace a worn-out idler roller weighing approximately 70 kg and measuring 1.2 meters in length. As Jorge lifted the roller off its mounting bracket, he lost control of it, causing it to fall onto his right foot with considerable force. The impact resulted in severe bruising and swelling around the ankle area, prompting Carlos to immediately summon medical assistance from the on-site first aid station.

During a routine maintenance procedure on a 30-ton overhead crane, an employee attempted to dislodge a stuck load cell by manually pushing against it while standing between the counterweight and the main beam of the crane. As they applied pressure, their right hand became wedged in the gap, causing significant compression injuries to fingers three through five.

During a routine maintenance operation on a conveyor belt system, an employee's hand became trapped between two moving pulleys while attempting to clear a jammed section of the belt. The incident occurred when he reached out with his right hand to grasp a loose screw, which had fallen onto the moving surface. His gloved hand was caught in the narrow gap between the rotating drums and remained stuck for several minutes before being freed by coworkers. As a result, the employee suffered minor bruising on their wrist and finger but no serious injuries were reported.

During a routine maintenance check on conveyor belt 3, an employee was tasked with inspecting a faulty gear box located at the end of the belt. As he reached for the malfunctioning part, his right hand slipped and got caught between two metal plates that were not properly secured to the frame. The pressure caused lacerations on the palmar surface of his index finger, which required immediate medical attention due to excessive bleeding.

During a routine inspection on a conveyor belt system, an operator attempts to clear a blockage in one of the sections by using a pry bar to dislodge the stuck material. As he applies pressure, the pry bar slips and hits his right hand against the metal frame of the conveyor belt's support beam, causing bruising and swelling.

During routine maintenance on a conveyor belt system, an operator was tasked with removing debris from the rollers using a metal scraper. As he worked near the edge of the platform, his colleague accidentally started the adjacent machinery, causing a loose bolt (8x4x2cm) to fall and strike the operator's right wrist at approximately 45 degrees angle, resulting in lacerations and bruising.

During a routine inspection of the conveyor belt system, an operator's foot slipped on the wet floor while attempting to access the motor control panel at the 10-meter mark. The sudden loss of balance caused him to fall onto the moving chain, which was not properly secured due to a malfunctioning tensioner. As he tried to regain his footing, his left hand became entangled in the chain's mesh and suffered severe lacerations before it finally stopped due to an automatic shutdown mechanism triggered by the operator's weight on the belt.

During routine cleaning activity in the storage tank 3 of the chemical warehouse 2A, an employee began to remove a thick layer of sediment at the bottom with a shovel, felt pain and numbness in his right wrist after being hit by a falling metal rod (30cmx5cm x4 cm; 1.8 Kg) that was suspended from the ceiling for maintenance purposes.

During the operation at Well 1234 in the area of São José dos Campos, around 12:45 pm, drilling equipment operator Carlos Alberto Silva was attempting to secure a hydraulic hose on the drill rig's platform when his gloved hand slipped and got pinched between the hose clamp and the metal frame. The pressure caused minor bruising and swelling on his right index finger. After receiving basic first aid from colleagues, Carlos was sent to the company clinic for further evaluation and treatment.

During the replacement operation on a 10-inch conveyor belt in the production area, an electrician was required to lift one end of the belt to access the damaged section. While attempting to maneuver the heavy equipment into position, the electrician lost his footing and fell against the moving belt, causing his right elbow to become entangled between two rollers. The subsequent attempt to free himself resulted in a deep laceration on the radial side of the forearm.

During a routine maintenance operation on the 345-PT-12 conveyor belt system, an employee slipped while navigating a narrow catwalk and fell onto his right shoulder with considerable force, causing injury due to prolonged exposure of the affected area to direct sunlight without adequate protection from UV radiation. The incident occurred at approximately 14:30 hours when ambient temperature was above average for that time of year.

During a routine inspection in the chemical storage area at 9:45 am, maintenance worker Eduardo attempts to replace a faulty level sensor on a tank containing hydrochloric acid (density 1.18 g/cm³). As he works from an elevated platform with no safety railings, his foot slips off the edge and becomes entangled in the ladder's rungs. The weight of his body causes him to fall approximately 2 meters onto the concrete floor below, where a puddle of hydrochloric acid has formed due to recent spills during previous maintenance tasks. Eduardo suffers minor injuries to his left ankle and knee but is otherwise unharmed.

At 9:15 a.m., while performing routine maintenance on conveyor belt C3, an employee attempts to adjust the pulley system and accidentally gets his right hand caught between two metal plates. The operator's gloved hand is pinched by the moving parts of the mechanism, causing minor lacerations and bruising. Medical assistance was summoned promptly for treatment.

During a routine maintenance procedure on the conveyor belt system at the processing plant, an operator attempted to replace a faulty roller bearing while standing on a raised platform with inadequate handrails. As he reached for the new bearing, his right arm slipped off the edge of the platform and got caught in the moving chain drive mechanism, causing severe lacerations on his forearm and wrist. The injured employee was immediately attended by first responders and transported to a nearby hospital where he received treatment and released after several hours.

During maintenance operations on a 36-inch pipeline, the operator, José Luis García, was attempting to loosen a stuck valve using an adjustable wrench when it suddenly slipped from his hand and struck him in the left palm, causing lacerations and bruising. The wound required sutures and resulted in a total of four points for medical treatment.

At a construction site where concrete pipes were being transported on a flatbed truck, one of the workers, Maria, was tasked with securing a loose pipe using wire ropes and clips. As she leaned over the edge of the truck bed, her left hand slipped off the railing and became entangled in the wires. The driver, Juan, attempted to free her by accelerating the vehicle, causing Maria's arm to be pulled against the pipes' metal surface. She suffered a deep gash on her wrist, but no bone fractures were reported. Both workers wore high-visibility vests at the time of the accident.

During a routine inspection of the conveyor belt in production area 3, employee Maria Rodriguez noticed an unusual vibration while walking along the catwalk above the moving belt. As she approached the suspected source of the noise, her foot slipped on a loose screw and she lost balance, falling onto the belt's edge with her right arm extended to break her fall. Her hand came into contact with a rotating pulley wheel, causing lacerations on her wrist and minor bruising around the elbow area. The incident occurred at 10:45 am and Maria was taken to the hospital for treatment, where she received stitches for three points of bleeding and was cleared for light duties after two days of recovery.

During routine maintenance on a conveyor belt system at an iron ore processing facility, two technicians were inspecting a worn-out idler roller when it suddenly failed and fell onto their colleague's right hand, causing significant bruising and swelling around the wrist area. The injured worker was transported to a nearby hospital for further evaluation and treatment, where he received stitches for minor lacerations on his palm.

During maintenance operations on conveyor belt 12 at the processing plant, an employee was attempting to clear a jammed section by hand when his sleeve became entangled in a rotating pulley system. As he struggled to free himself, his arm got caught between two adjacent rollers, causing a deep laceration above the elbow. The injured worker was promptly transported to the on-site medical center for treatment and received 6 stitches before being released with instructions to rest for the remainder of the shift.

During a routine inspection of the conveyor belt system at the processing plant, an employee was inspecting a section of the worn-out rubber belting when it suddenly snapped under their weight, causing them to lose balance and fall onto the exposed metal rollers below. The injured worker's left hand came into contact with one of the moving rollers, resulting in severe lacerations due to its sharp edges.

During a routine maintenance operation on the 345-PR-09 conveyor belt, an employee slipped while attempting to clean a stubborn stain from the rubberized surface. As he fell backwards, his gloved hand grasped for support but instead caught hold of a loose cable bundle that was not properly secured. The sudden jerk caused him to lose balance and fall onto his left shoulder, resulting in a deep gash on his elbow.

At 14:10 hours, maintenance technician Carlos Silva was performing routine checks on the conveyor belt system when he noticed a loose screw on one of the rollers. As he reached for it, his gloved hand slipped and got caught between the roller and the adjacent pulley wheel. The movement of the conveyor caused significant pressure to build up, resulting in a deep laceration on Carlos' left palm. He was immediately attended to by first aid responders and transported to the hospital for further treatment, where he received 4 points of sutures before being released with instructions for follow-up care.

During the maintenance activity on a 12-meter-long conveyor belt, an employee was tasked with tightening a loose bolt near the drive pulley. While attempting to access the bolt from underneath the belt, their right hand slipped and got caught between the moving belt and the stationary frame of the pulley system. The resulting crush injury affected the index finger, middle finger, and half of the ring finger on that hand, requiring immediate medical attention.

During a routine maintenance operation on a conveyor belt system, mechanic Juan was tasked by his supervisor, Carlos, to replace a worn-out idler pulley wheel. As he lifted the 25-kilogram wheel off its mounting bracket, it suddenly slipped from his grasp and fell onto his right hand, crushing two fingers between itself and the metal frame of the machine. The injured employee was immediately rushed to the on-site medical center for treatment by Carlos and another colleague.

During routine cleaning operations in the chemical storage area, a worker accidentally knocked over a 200-liter drum of sodium hydroxide solution while attempting to maneuver it onto a pallet jack. The spilled liquid flowed towards the employee's right leg, causing a splash burn that measured approximately 10 cm x 5 cm.

During the operation of a conveyor belt in the processing area, an employee attempts to clear a jam by manually lifting a heavy metal plate weighing approximately 12 kilograms. As he struggles to lift it, his grip falters and the plate falls onto his right hand, causing minor bruising and swelling. The injured worker was treated on-site and released after receiving first aid from colleagues.

During maintenance operations on a conveyor belt system, an employee was tasked with cleaning debris from underneath the rollers. While reaching under one of the rollers, their right hand came into contact with a loose screw that had fallen onto the floor earlier in the day. The screw, approximately 5 cm long and weighing around 100 grams, punctured the skin on the palmar surface of the employee's index finger, causing bleeding and moderate pain.

During maintenance operations on a conveyor belt in sector 3B, technician Antonio Pereira attempted to remove a stuck pulley wheel using a hydraulic wrench. As he applied pressure, his right hand slipped and became wedged between the wrench's handle and the stationary frame of the machine. Realizing his mistake, Antonio quickly released the wrench but suffered a deep laceration on his ring finger due to the forceful separation. The injured technician was transported to the on-site medical facility for treatment, receiving 4 points suturing and being cleared for light duties pending further evaluation.

During a routine maintenance operation on a conveyor belt system, an employee's hand became caught between two adjacent rollers as he was attempting to clear debris from the area. The force of the rolling motion caused significant pressure and bruising to his left index finger. After receiving immediate medical attention, it was determined that no fracture had occurred.

During routine maintenance on a conveyor belt system, an employee was tasked with replacing a worn-out pulley wheel. As he reached for the replacement part, his footing slipped on a patch of oil spilled earlier in the day, causing him to lose balance and fall onto the moving chain. His right hand became entangled in the chain's links as it passed through the sprocket, resulting in severe lacerations and bruising. The employee was able to free himself after several minutes but required immediate medical attention for his injuries.

During maintenance operations on a conveyor belt system at the production facility, an employee was tasked with replacing worn-out rollers in one of the conveyors' sections. While attempting to remove a stubborn roller from its mounting bracket, he lost his grip and accidentally dropped it onto his left hand, causing a deep laceration between the thumb and index finger. The injured worker immediately sought medical attention at the on-site first aid station before being transported to a nearby hospital for further treatment.

During a routine inspection in sector 3B of the processing plant, an employee named Jorge Silva encountered a malfunctioning conveyor belt. While attempting to clear the blockage, his gloved hand slipped into the moving machinery's gap and became trapped between two rotating drums. The drum's abrasive surface caused lacerations on his left palm, requiring immediate medical attention. After receiving treatment at the on-site infirmary, Jorge was released for light duties pending further evaluation of the severity of the injury.

During the operation of the conveyor belt 3456 in the production area, a mechanical failure caused a broken chain section to fall onto the floor, striking operator Maria Rodriguez who was walking nearby with her right hand holding a clipboard and left hand carrying a toolbox. The impact resulted in lacerations on her right palm and minor bruising on her forehead.

During a routine maintenance procedure on the conveyor belt system, an assistant was tasked with removing a jammed screwdriver lodged in the moving rollers of the belt. The assistant stood at a height of approximately 1.8 meters and used a long-handled tool to dislodge the screwdriver from its stuck position. As the screwdriver came loose, it swung back towards the assistant's body, striking their right wrist against the metal frame of the conveyor system.

During routine maintenance on a conveyor belt system, an operator attempted to loosen a stubborn bolt using a wrench while standing at the edge of the platform. As he applied additional force, his footing slipped and the wrench fell from his hand, striking him in the right forearm between two metal beams. The resulting injury required immediate medical attention.

During the installation of a new electrical panel in an industrial setting, the technician accidentally touched two exposed wires while attempting to connect them, causing a brief arc flash and subsequent burn on his right hand. The employee was wearing flame-resistant clothing at the time but not gloves, which contributed to the severity of the injury.

During maintenance operations on a conveyor belt at 14:47 hours, an assistant attempted to dislodge a jammed screw using pliers while standing near the moving belt. The screw suddenly released and rolled towards their right leg, causing minor bruising and lacerations due to its impact with the knee area.

At approximately 10:30 hours in probe 4211 bore BAPDD00123, employee Sofia Rodriguez was performing a manual cleaning operation on a conveyor belt when her gloved hand slipped off the surface and got caught between the moving rollers. She managed to free herself by applying force with her other arm but suffered a deep gash on her left palm. First aid treatment was administered at the scene before she was transported to hospital for further medical attention, resulting in 4 points of injury and subsequent release from work duties.

During the excavation work in probe 3456 bore BAPDD00123, around 12:30 hours, the driller José Carlos da Silva was operating a jackhammer to break up rock formations when his safety harness suddenly failed due to worn-out components. He fell approximately 3 meters from the platform onto the rocky floor, suffering severe bruising and lacerations on his left leg and hand. The impact also caused a nearby stack of drill bits to topple over, which narrowly missed striking another worker standing nearby.

During maintenance operations on a conveyor belt system, an assistant was tasked with cleaning debris from beneath a drive roller using a metal scraper. While attempting to dislodge a stubborn chunk of material, the assistant's gloved hand slipped and became wedged between the scraper's edge and the roller's surface, resulting in laceration injuries to the distal phalanx of their left index finger.

During a maintenance operation on an electrical panel, an employee attempted to remove a faulty fuse using a pair of pliers while standing on a ladder. As he was twisting and pulling the fuse out, his left hand slipped off the rung of the ladder, causing him to lose balance. He fell onto the concrete floor with his right elbow landing awkwardly between two stacked crates, resulting in bruising but no fracture. The employee wore safety glasses at the time of the accident.

During routine maintenance on a 24-inch pipe conveyor system, an employee attempted to clear a blockage by manually manipulating a pivot joint while standing in close proximity to moving machinery. As they adjusted the joint, their right arm was pinched between the machine's housing and a nearby beam, resulting in lacerations to the forearm and pinky finger.

During routine maintenance on a conveyor belt system, an employee was tasked with replacing a worn-out rubber drum (diameter 80cm and thickness 5mm) on the 121-BC-03 crusher unit. While attempting to lift the new drum into place using a metal hoist bar (length 2m), he lost his grip due to excessive sweat caused by high ambient temperatures, resulting in the drum falling onto his left foot, causing a severe laceration requiring immediate medical attention.

At approximately 9:45 a.m., during routine maintenance on drill rig D-12, driller Juan Sanchez was attempting to loosen a stuck pipe coupling using a hydraulic breaker tool. As he applied force with the hammer end of the tool, his left hand slipped off the handle and became caught between the moving parts of the device and the surrounding metal frame. The impact caused a deep laceration on the palmar surface of Juan's left hand, requiring immediate medical attention.

During a routine maintenance operation on a conveyor belt system at the Nro 3 processing plant, two workers, Julio (injured) and Santiago, were tasked with replacing a worn-out pulley wheel measuring approximately 1.2 meters in diameter and weighing around 250 kilograms. After lifting the heavy component into place using an overhead crane, Julio attempted to secure it by tightening the bolts while standing on a raised platform at a height of about 3.5 meters above ground level. Suddenly, one of the loose bolts fell from its socket, striking Julio's right forearm and causing severe bruising and lacerations. The supervisor rushed to assist the injured worker, who was subsequently transported to the medical center for treatment.

During routine maintenance on a conveyor belt system at 02:15 hours, Mr. Lopez, the chief mechanic, noticed an unusual vibration emanating from one of the idler pulleys. As he attempted to inspect the area more closely, his gloved hand slipped off the railing and became caught between the rotating drum and the stationary frame, causing a deep laceration on his index finger. The incident occurred while Mr. Lopez was wearing safety glasses but not ear protection due to the relatively low noise level of the machinery at that time.

At 14:20 hours, during a routine maintenance operation on conveyor belt number 12 at the ore processing plant, operator Maria Rodriguez noticed an unusual vibration coming from the motorized pulley system. She approached the area cautiously and attempted to adjust the tension of one of the belts when suddenly, a loose screw came flying out of the mechanism, striking her in the left temple with sufficient force to cause bleeding. The impact caused her to stumble backward, resulting in a minor concussion and laceration on the forehead. Maria was promptly attended to by plant medical personnel and transported to a nearby hospital for further evaluation and treatment.

During routine maintenance on a 300-ton overhead crane, an employee attempts to loosen a stubborn bolt using an adjustable wrench while standing on a metal grating platform suspended 15 feet above the ground. As he applies increasing force, the platform's rusty railing gives way, causing him to lose his balance and fall onto the concrete floor below, landing awkwardly with his right shoulder absorbing most of the impact.

During a routine inspection of the heat exchanger 14BP0123 in the chemical processing unit, an unexpected pressure drop was detected while employee Juan was accessing the control panel for maintenance work. The sudden release of pressurized steam caused Juan's protective gear to fail, resulting in minor burns on his right hand and arm from direct exposure.

During the operation of the hydraulic press in the production area at 8:15 a.m., an unexpected malfunction occurred when attempting to extract a stuck component, causing one of the moving parts to suddenly release and strike the operator's right elbow with moderate force, resulting in bruising and swelling. The employee was treated on-site by first aid personnel before being referred to São José Hospital for further evaluation and released after receiving necessary medical attention.

During routine maintenance works on conveyor belt 3; after having completed lubrication tasks for the fourth time in a row, the technician accidentally dropped a metal tool (length: 60cm x width: 4 cm) from a height of approximately one meter onto his right foot while trying to reposition it. The technician at the time was wearing steel-toed shoes and had been working on uneven terrain with slippery conditions due to recent rainfall.

During maintenance operations on a conveyor belt system, an employee was attempting to clear a jammed section by manually dislodging stuck material when their gloved hand became pinched between two adjacent rollers, resulting in minor lacerations and bruising on the left forearm.

During the replacement of a worn-out conveyor belt on production line 3B, maintenance technician Maria Rodriguez attempted to lift one end of the old belt using a manual lifting device. However, she lost her grip and felt the weight of the belt forcing her left hand between its metal frame and the concrete floor. The impact caused a deep laceration on her palm, requiring immediate medical attention at the site's infirmary before being transferred to a local hospital for further treatment.

During maintenance operations at the electrical substation in São João da Boa Vista, an employee from the company Energisa suffered a minor injury while attempting to replace a faulty circuit breaker. As he was lifting the heavy device into position, it slipped and fell onto his right ankle, causing a bruise and swelling. The injured worker received medical attention on-site and returned to work after being treated for approximately 30 minutes without any further complications.

During a routine maintenance operation on a conveyor belt system in sector 3B, a technician, Juan Carlos Rodriguez, was tasked with replacing a faulty roller bearing. As he attempted to remove the old bearing, his gloved hand slipped and became caught between the moving rollers and the stationary frame of the machine. The pressure caused a deep laceration on the dorsal side of his index finger, requiring immediate medical attention. After receiving treatment at the on-site infirmary, Juan was cleared for light duties with proper bandaging and monitoring to prevent infection.

During a maintenance operation on an inclined conveyor belt at the processing plant, a worker was tasked with removing a stuck piece of debris using a hydraulic jack and a metal rod. As he attempted to lift the object, it suddenly dislodged and fell onto his leg, causing severe crushing injuries due to its weight (approximately 120 kg). The injured employee was wearing steel-toed boots but no other personal protective equipment at the time of the accident. He suffered multiple fractures in both legs as well as severe lacerations on his calf.

At approximately 01:20 hours, operator Mrs. Rodriguez was performing routine maintenance on conveyor belt #3 when she accidentally touched a live electrical wire while attempting to clear a jammed section of equipment. The resulting shock caused her left arm to twitch involuntarily and briefly lose sensation in the hand.

At approximately 02:10 hours, Mr. Rodriguez, a maintenance technician, was inspecting the electrical panel of conveyor belt number three when he noticed a loose wire hanging from the control box. As he reached out to secure it with his right hand, the wire suddenly snapped back into place, striking him on the index finger and causing lacerations requiring stitches.

During a routine inspection of the conveyor belt system, maintenance worker Juan Hernandez accidentally triggered the automatic tensioning mechanism while attempting to dislodge a stuck pulley wheel with his right hand. The sudden and unexpected movement caused his gloved finger to become pinched between two adjacent rollers, resulting in a deep laceration that required immediate medical attention.

At a construction site where workers were preparing for concrete pouring, an incident occurred when two laborers lifted a metal chute (approximately 3 meters long and weighing around 30 kg) off the ground to position it over a trench. As they raised the chute, one of them accidentally dropped their end-handled tool onto his left hand, causing finger entrapment between the tool's grip and the chute's structure. The injured worker was treated at the site medical center for minor lacerations on two fingers without any reported fractures or serious injuries. Both workers were wearing protective gloves during the incident.

At approximately 02:10 hours, operator Rodriguez was performing routine maintenance on conveyor belt 3 when a loose bolt fell from above and struck his right forearm, causing an open wound measuring 7 cm in length and 2 mm in depth. The impact occurred while the operator's arm was positioned near the edge of the catwalk, approximately 1 meter off the ground, with no safety harness or guardrail nearby to prevent a potential fall.

At 9:15 a.m., an operator attempts to replace a faulty electrical cable on a conveyor belt while wearing insulated gloves, but accidentally touches two exposed wires with his left hand, causing a shock that results in second-degree burns on the palm and fingers. The employee is treated at the site by first aid responders before being transported to a medical center for further evaluation.

During routine maintenance on a conveyor belt system, an operator attempted to remove a stuck pulley wheel by applying pressure with a hydraulic jack. As he increased the pressure, the jack suddenly released, causing it to swing back and strike his right forearm at approximately 20 cm from the elbow joint. The impact resulted in significant bruising and swelling of the affected area, requiring immediate medical attention.

During a maintenance operation on conveyor belt 3456 at level 2500, an operator named Pedro attempted to clear a blockage using a pneumatic drill. As he was working in confined space with inadequate ventilation, the dust and debris created by the drilling process reduced visibility significantly. Suddenly, a loose bolt from the machinery fell onto his left hand, causing severe lacerations and crushing injuries due to its weight of approximately 0.5 kg. The operator's safety gloves did not provide adequate protection against the impact, resulting in multiple deep cuts on his fingers and palm.

In the maintenance area of the processing plant, a technician was performing routine checks on the conveyor belt system at approximately 10:30 hours when he accidentally triggered an emergency stop mechanism while reaching for a loose screw. The sudden deceleration caused him to lose his balance and fall onto the moving parts of the machinery, resulting in lacerations on both knees and minor bruising. Despite wearing safety glasses and gloves, the technician suffered multiple abrasions from contact with metal surfaces during the incident. He was promptly attended to by medical personnel at the site's first aid station before being released for further treatment off-site.

During maintenance operations on conveyor belt 3, an employee was inspecting a faulty section when a loose bolt (6cm x 4cm) fell from above and struck their right ankle. The worker was wearing steel-toed shoes at the time of the accident but did not have any other personal protective equipment on.

During a maintenance operation on a 36-inch pipeline, an employee was attempting to remove a stubborn valve when it suddenly gave way, causing him to lose his footing and fall onto the metal surface below. The impact resulted in compression injuries to both ankles, with one sustaining a more severe laceration requiring sutures.

During routine maintenance on a conveyor belt system, an employee was tasked with tightening loose screws using a manual screwdriver. While working at elevated heights, he lost his footing and fell onto the moving chain of the conveyor belt, causing him to slip and struggle to regain balance. In the process, his gloved hand became caught between two adjacent rollers, resulting in significant bruising and lacerations on multiple fingers. The employee was promptly extracted from the hazardous situation by coworkers and transported to a nearby medical facility for treatment.

During maintenance operations on a conveyor belt system, an employee was tasked with cleaning debris from beneath the rollers. While doing so, they accidentally triggered the automatic start mechanism for one of the idlers, causing it to rotate suddenly and strike their right forearm against the frame of the adjacent roller. The impact resulted in bruising but no reported fractures or lacerations; external medical attention was sought as a precautionary measure.

During a maintenance operation on the 345-RT-12 conveyor belt, an employee was checking the pulleys when his safety harness got entangled in the moving mechanism. As he tried to free himself, the belt's rotation caused him to swing violently against a metal beam, resulting in severe bruising and lacerations on his chest and arms. The incident occurred at approximately 14:45 hours with both workers wearing hard hats and steel-toed boots; however, their safety harnesses did not meet company standards for this specific task.

During a routine maintenance operation on a conveyor belt system, an unexpected malfunction occurred when one of the rollers supporting the belt suddenly disengaged from its mounting bracket. As a result, the roller fell 1.5 meters onto the concrete floor, striking and pinning down a worker who was in close proximity to the area. The impact caused bruising on the worker's left forearm and minor lacerations above their right eyebrow. Both workers were wearing standard-issue hard hats and safety glasses at the time of the incident.

During a routine maintenance operation on the conveyor belt system; after having cleared the accumulated debris from the belt's idler pulley, the technician positions himself near the drive motor with his right hand holding onto the exposed gear housing for balance. At this moment, an unsecured metal plate (30cmx20cm x2mm) falls off the nearby machinery and strikes the back of the technician's right hand, causing a minor laceration on the palmar surface. The technician was wearing safety gloves with Kevlar padding at the time of the accident.

While performing a routine inspection on the conveyor belt system, an employee's hand became caught in a narrow gap between two moving rollers during maintenance activities, resulting in lacerations and bruising to their fingers.

During maintenance operations on a 500-liter storage tank, an employee attempted to loosen a corroded valve using a socket wrench while standing at the side of the tank. As he applied force, his gloved hand slipped and became caught between the valve stem and the surrounding metal plate. The accident resulted in a deep laceration on the middle finger of his left hand, requiring medical attention but no surgical intervention was necessary.

During a routine inspection on the conveyor belt system; an operator attempts to clear a jammed roller using a wire brush while standing at a height of approximately 1 meter from the ground, when suddenly the roller shifts causing the brush handle to strike his right forearm with considerable force. The injured employee was wearing safety glasses and steel-toed boots but did not have on any protective gloves or knee pads during the incident.

At 9:15 a.m., operator Juan is tasked with replacing a faulty conveyor belt on the production line. While attempting to lift one end of the old belt, it suddenly snaps back into place, causing his right hand to become trapped between the rollers and the frame. After struggling for several minutes, he manages to free himself but suffers severe lacerations and bruising on his hand. Juan is rushed to the medical center by a colleague for treatment.

During a routine inspection of the conveyor belt system in Area 3 of the São Francisco refinery, an employee accidentally activated the emergency stop button while attempting to clear a jammed section at approximately 2:15 pm. The sudden deceleration caused a nearby storage container filled with metal scraps to shift and fall onto his right ankle, resulting in a moderate laceration requiring on-site medical attention before being transported to Hospital São José for further treatment and eventual release after receiving stitches.

During a routine maintenance operation on the conveyor belt system, worker Juan was tasked by his supervisor, Carlos, to inspect and clear any debris from beneath the moving belts. As he crawled under the structure, he noticed a loose bolt had fallen onto the floor, partially obstructing the path of the belt. Attempting to retrieve it with his right hand, Juan's fingers became trapped between the bolt and the metal frame as the conveyor system continued to operate. The supervisor immediately called for assistance, and medical personnel rushed to the scene to treat the injured worker.

During a routine maintenance operation on a conveyor belt system at an industrial facility, a worker's left hand was caught between two moving rollers while attempting to clear a jammed section of the machinery. The incident occurred when the worker reached into the rollers' path without ensuring proper clearance, resulting in a deep laceration on their index finger and minor bruising around the affected area.

During maintenance works on a conveyor belt in the crushing plant area; while checking for blockages after stopping the equipment, an employee's gloved hand slipped off the metal plate and got caught between two rotating drums with a diameter of 30cm each. The accident occurred when the left thumb was stuck at approximately 10:20 am.

During a routine maintenance check on the conveyor belt system in sector 3B, an employee was performing a visual inspection of the pulleys when their right hand accidentally slipped into the gap between two rotating drums while trying to adjust a loose screw with pliers. The drum's rotation caused a small metal fragment (5cm x 2cm) to fly off and strike the distal phalanx of the index finger, resulting in an injury requiring medical attention. At the time of the accident, the employee was wearing standard-issue safety gloves and had received training on conveyor belt maintenance procedures.

During a maintenance operation on a conveyor belt system at the company's production facility, an employee accidentally activated a reversing mechanism while attempting to clear a jammed section of the belt. A 120 kg metal pulley wheel was dislodged and fell from approximately 3 meters above ground level onto the worker's left shoulder, causing significant bruising and lacerations. The victim was treated on-site for minor injuries before being transported to a local medical center for further evaluation and treatment.

During a routine maintenance operation on a conveyor belt system, an employee was tasked with replacing a worn-out pulley wheel. As he lifted the heavy replacement part into place, his gloved hand slipped and became trapped between the moving components of the machinery. The victim's arm remained stuck as colleagues rushed to free him from the hazardous situation. After receiving medical attention on-site, it was determined that there were no serious injuries or fractures sustained in the incident.

During maintenance operations on the conveyor belt system at 14:45 hours, operator Maria Rodriguez was adjusting a faulty drive pulley when her right hand slipped and became entangled in the moving rollers' mesh. As she attempted to free herself, her index finger got caught between two adjacent rollers, causing a deep laceration. The injury required immediate medical attention; after receiving treatment at the on-site clinic, Maria returned to light duties with restrictions.

During a routine maintenance procedure on a conveyor belt system at an industrial facility, a worker's arm became entangled in the moving pulley mechanism while attempting to clear a jammed section of the line. The worker, wearing standard issue safety gloves and a hard hat, struggled to free themselves as the machine continued to operate, causing minor lacerations on their forearm before they were eventually able to extricate themselves with assistance from colleagues.

Worker Carlos was operating a conveyor belt in Sector 3, Level 2400. While clearing jammed debris, his right hand slipped into an open gear compartment and got stuck between two rotating drums. He quickly pulled his arm free, but suffered lacerations on the palm and fingers of his dominant hand.

During a routine inspection of the conveyor belt system in production area 3B, operator Maria Rodriguez used her right hand to manually adjust a misaligned pulley wheel on the moving belt. As she attempted to tighten a loose screw with a hex key wrench, the tool slipped from her grasp and struck her ring finger between the metal frame and the rotating drum of the conveyor system. The resulting laceration required sutures at the local medical center and kept Maria out of work for three days pending further evaluation.

At approximately 10:45 a.m., maintenance worker Carlos was performing routine checks on conveyor belt 2145 when he accidentally got his left hand caught in an exposed gear mechanism while attempting to adjust a loose screw. With immediate assistance from colleague Maria, they managed to free the stuck limb after applying gentle pressure and rotating it slowly, resulting in minor lacerations on the palm of Carlos' hand requiring basic first aid treatment.

During maintenance operations on a conveyor belt system, an employee was tasked with replacing a worn-out pulley wheel. While lifting the 30-kilogram replacement part into position, he lost his grip and it fell onto his right hand, causing crushing injuries to three fingers due to its weight and impact. The injured worker received immediate medical attention at the on-site clinic before being transported to a nearby hospital for further treatment.

During a routine maintenance operation on a conveyor belt system; an operator uses a wrench to loosen a bolt securing a pulley wheel, when suddenly the loose bolt falls onto his right foot causing a deep laceration (approx. 10 cm in length). The worker was wearing steel-toed boots at the time of the accident and had received minimal training on the specific maintenance procedure being performed.

During the maintenance operation on a conveyor belt in the production area of ​​Fábrica de Produtos Químicos, around 12:30 pm, operator João Carlos suffered an injury while attempting to remove a blockage from the system. As he inserted his right hand into the narrow space between two rollers to dislodge the obstruction, another piece of debris fell onto his fingers, causing a deep laceration on the palmar surface of his index finger and partial amputation of the distal phalanx. The injured employee was immediately transported to Hospital São José and received medical attention; after treatment, he was released with instructions for follow-up care and limited work duties until full recovery.

During a routine maintenance check on the conveyor belt system at 02:15 am, operator Maria failed to notice a loose screw protruding from the machinery's casing. As she reached for it with her left hand, her gloved fingers slipped and became pinched between the rotating drum and the stationary frame, causing significant lacerations. The incident occurred while Maria was wearing insulated gloves but not safety glasses due to the dim lighting conditions in the maintenance area.

During a routine inspection on the conveyor belt system, the maintenance technician attempted to clear a jammed pulley wheel by inserting his right hand into the narrow gap between the wheel and its housing. As he pushed against the wheel to dislodge it, his glove caught on an exposed metal edge, causing lacerations on the back of his hand. The work area was well-lit at the time of the accident, but the technician's focus was diverted by a sudden loud noise from another part of the facility.

During routine maintenance on conveyor belt 5, employee Juan was tasked by his supervisor, Carlos, to replace a worn-out idler pulley wheel weighing approximately 25 kg. As Juan lifted the wheel off its mounting bracket using a hydraulic jack and metal bar, it suddenly slipped from his grasp and fell onto his right foot, causing severe pain and bruising.

During a routine inspection of the conveyor belt in sector 3, maintenance worker Maria Rodriguez was instructed to replace a faulty pulley wheel on the upper level of the equipment. As she reached for the replacement part, her gloved hand slipped and grasped onto an exposed gear shaft rotating at approximately 100 RPM. The sudden jerk caused her wrist to twist awkwardly, resulting in a severe strain injury that required immediate medical attention.

During maintenance operations on a conveyor belt in the processing area, an employee attempted to clear a blockage by using a metal rod. As he pushed the debris towards one end of the belt, it suddenly gave way and fell onto his foot, causing bruising and swelling. The injured worker was transported to the on-site medical center for treatment and later released after receiving first aid care.

During a routine maintenance operation on a 36" pipe section, an employee attempted to loosen a rusty flange connection using a wrench while standing at the base of the structure. As he applied force, the loosening pipe suddenly dropped from its elevated position, striking him with considerable impact and pinning his right leg against the steel beam supporting the catwalk. The injured worker was promptly evacuated for medical attention, whereupon it was determined that there were no fractures sustained in the incident.

During a routine inspection of the conveyor belt system, two maintenance workers were tasked with replacing a faulty idler roller. As they lifted the old roller off its mounting bracket, it suddenly slipped from their grasp and fell approximately 1.5 meters onto the concrete floor below. The impact caused one worker to lose his footing on the wet surface, resulting in him slipping and falling against the adjacent machinery support beam. His right arm became trapped between the beam's edge and a nearby pipe, causing a deep laceration that required immediate medical attention.

During a routine maintenance operation on a conveyor belt system, an employee attempted to clear a jammed section by manually pulling out debris stuck between rollers. As he did so, his right hand got caught in the gap between two adjacent rollers, causing lacerations and bruising. The injured worker was wearing gloves but not safety glasses at the time of the accident.

During the excavation process in a coal mine, an explosion occurred when methane gas accumulated at a depth of approximately 30 meters suddenly ignited due to an electrical spark from a faulty drilling machine. The blast caused significant damage to nearby structures and equipment, including a crane that collapsed on top of a storage container filled with flammable liquids. Two workers were injured in the incident: one suffered severe burns on his face and arms after being caught near the explosion site, while another sustained multiple fractures when crushed by falling debris from the collapsed structure.

During a routine maintenance procedure on a conveyor belt system at Stop 3456, Level 2500, the operator removed a clogged screw from the machinery's rotating drum using a pair of pliers. As he attempted to lift the screw out of the drum, it suddenly slipped and struck his right hand, causing an open wound on the palmar surface between the third and fourth fingers. The work area was well-lit at the time of the accident, with no hazardous conditions present that could have contributed to the incident.

During the maintenance operation on a conveyor belt system, an employee attempted to remove a stuck screwdriver lodged between two metal rollers using pliers. As he applied force, his right index finger became pinched between the rolling surface and the fixed frame of the roller, causing minor lacerations and bruising. The injured worker was treated by first aid personnel on site before being cleared to resume duties without further incident.

During a routine inspection of the conveyor belt system in the processing plant, two technicians were accessing the underside of the 4-meter-long steel beam using an aerial platform at a height of approximately 3 meters above ground level. While attempting to tighten a loose bolt on one end of the beam, the technician's harness suddenly became entangled with the metal structure, causing him to lose his balance and fall from the platform. The other technician attempted to grab hold of his colleague but was unable to do so due to the distance between them. As a result, the injured worker landed awkwardly on his right shoulder, suffering a severe strain that required immediate medical attention.

At 9:15 a.m., an operator was performing maintenance on a conveyor belt when their sleeve got caught in a rotating drum, causing lacerations on the forearm and wrist area. After attempting to free themselves, they were assisted by colleagues who eventually managed to release them from the machinery, but not before sustaining moderate injuries that required medical attention at the site's first aid center.

At 02:10 hours, Mr. Rodriguez, a maintenance technician, was inspecting the electrical panel of machine #304 in preparation for routine maintenance when he noticed an unusual smell emanating from one of the circuit breakers. As he approached to investigate further, the breaker suddenly malfunctioned and released a burst of hot sparks that struck his right shoulder, causing minor burns and singeing his uniform.

During a routine maintenance procedure on a conveyor belt system at Stop 1234, Level 2100, an employee was tasked with cleaning a blockage in one of the belts' rollers using a long-handled brush. While attempting to dislodge the debris, he lost his footing and fell onto the moving belt, causing him to be dragged for approximately 10 feet before being stopped by coworkers who quickly responded to the incident. The employee suffered minor injuries including bruising on both knees and elbows as well as lacerations on his hands due to contact with metal edges of the machinery.

During a routine inspection in sector 3B of the processing plant, operator Maria Rodriguez was investigating an unusual noise emanating from conveyor belt CB-12 when her foot slipped on a loose metal plate and she lost balance. As she regained footing, her arm brushed against the moving conveyor's edge guardrail, causing minor cuts to her wrist. The incident occurred at 08:45 hours and Maria was treated by plant first responders before being released for further duties with bandaged injuries totaling three points.

During the replacement of a worn-out gear on a conveyor belt, an employee was tasked with loosening bolts on the drive shaft while standing on a raised platform. As he attempted to use his right hand to apply additional force, it slipped and came into contact with the moving parts of the machinery, causing lacerations on the thumb and index finger.

During a routine maintenance operation on the conveyor belt system, worker Juan is tasked by his supervisor, Carlos, to inspect and replace worn-out rollers at the transfer point between belts 3 and 4. After accessing the area through the designated access ladder, Juan begins to remove loose debris from around one of the rollers using a handheld brush. As he leans forward to reach into a tight space, his left hand slips off the railing due to excessive wear on the grip, causing him to lose balance and fall approximately two feet onto the moving conveyor belt. The sudden impact results in partial amputation of Juan's middle finger.

During a routine maintenance operation on the conveyor belt system at approximately 2:45 pm, mechanical technician John accidentally triggered the release mechanism of a suspended platform while attempting to clear debris from the overhead tracks. The sudden drop caused him to lose his footing and fall onto the moving conveyor belt, with his right arm pinned between the metal frame and the rolling surface. After receiving medical attention on-site, it was determined that he suffered no fractures or life-threatening injuries.

During a routine inspection of the conveyor belt system, an employee attempted to clear a jammed section by manually pulling on the stuck material. As they did so, their right hand became wedged between the moving belt and a stationary metal frame. The resulting force caused bruising and minor swelling in the affected area, but no fractures were sustained. At the time of the incident, the employee was wearing standard-issue work gloves with moderate grip protection.

During a routine inspection on the 345-PR-02 conveyor belt, an employee lost his footing while walking along the catwalk and fell onto the moving chain, causing a sharp edge of the sprocket wheel to lacerate his right shin. The wound required immediate medical attention.

During a routine maintenance operation on a drilling rig, an employee was injured when attempting to retrieve a loose pipe section from a confined space. The worker, wearing standard personal protective equipment (PPE), carefully navigated the area using a flashlight and tried to grasp the pipe with his gloved hand. However, as he reached for it, the pipe suddenly moved due to its unstable position on an uneven surface, causing his right index finger to become trapped between the pipe's edge and a metal bracket. The employee was quickly treated by first responders and transported to a local hospital for further evaluation and treatment.

At 14:10 hours, maintenance technician Carlos Silva is performing routine checks on conveyor belt #321 when he notices a faulty motorized pulley. As he attempts to secure it with wire ties, his gloved hand slips and gets caught between the moving pulleys. The sudden jerk causes lacerations on his left palm and index finger. He is immediately attended by first responders and transported to the hospital for treatment, receiving 4 points of sutures due to moderate bleeding.

During a routine maintenance operation on one of the plant's reactors, three workers - equipped with safety harnesses - were suspended from above to access the reactor's upper section. Their supervisor, Carlos, was directing them remotely via radio communication. As they worked, the worker named Ana suddenly lost her grip and fell 3 meters onto the metal grating below, landing awkwardly on her right arm and shoulder. The impact caused a loud noise, startling everyone in the vicinity.

During a routine maintenance operation on the 345-TR-12 conveyor belt system, an employee was tasked with adjusting a bolt located at a height of approximately 2 meters above ground level. Using a ladder and wearing personal protective equipment, he attempted to reach the bolt but lost his footing due to uneven terrain, causing him to fall backwards onto the concrete floor. His right hand came into contact with the edge of the conveyor belt's metal frame, resulting in a deep laceration on the palmar surface. The employee was immediately taken to the site medical center for treatment and further evaluation.

During a routine maintenance operation at the processing plant's conveyor belt system in the late morning hours, an employee attempted to adjust a loose screw on one of the belt's idler rollers. As he was leaning over the roller, his colleague, who was standing nearby and holding onto the adjacent roller for balance, lost their footing due to uneven terrain and fell against the victim, causing them both to lose control. The resulting momentum sent the employee's hard hat flying off their head and striking a metal beam supporting the conveyor belt structure with considerable force, leaving him with minor lacerations on his forehead.

On a routine maintenance day at the processing plant, technician Sofia was tasked by her supervisor, Ivan, to replace a faulty motor housing on one of the production lines. As she lifted the heavy component off its pedestal, it slipped from her grasp and fell onto her right foot, causing crushing injuries due to the weight (approximately 80 kg) and angle of impact. The incident occurred at around 10:45 am in well-lit conditions with no other employees nearby.

In the pipe 4211 bore FAPDD00212, at approximately 10:45 hours, maintenance technician Carlos Rodriguez was performing a routine inspection when his gloved hand slipped while handling a wrench, causing it to fall and strike him on the ring finger. The impact resulted in a laceration requiring sutures, with an estimated recovery time of seven days for full healing.

During a routine inspection on the conveyor belt 3456 at approximately 08:45 hours, operator Maria Rodriguez inadvertently triggered the emergency stop mechanism while attempting to clear a jammed section of production materials. The sudden deceleration caused by the rapid halt resulted in Maria's right hand being crushed between the moving and stationary parts of the machinery, sustaining significant bruising and lacerations. Medical attention was promptly provided on-site before transferring her to hospital for further treatment and evaluation.

During a routine inspection in the chemical storage area, an employee accidentally knocks over a 500-liter drum of concentrated acid while attempting to move it using a forklift with defective brakes. The drum rolls approximately 10 meters before coming to rest against a stack of drums, causing one of them to fall and strike the victim's leg at a height of about 1 meter.

During maintenance operations on a conveyor belt system, an employee was inspecting a worn-out pulley wheel when his right arm got caught in the moving chain. As he tried to free himself, the chain snapped back into place, causing a deep laceration on the outer side of his forearm and bruising on his shoulder. The incident occurred while both workers involved were wearing hard hats and safety glasses; however, neither was wearing gloves at the time due to the specific task requirements.

During routine maintenance on a conveyor belt system, an operator attempted to remove a stuck screwdriver from between two rollers using pliers while standing in a narrow aisle with poor visibility due to shadows cast by overhead pipes. As he manipulated the pliers, his gloved hand slipped and the screwdriver was forced through the glove's fabric, causing lacerations on the palm of his left hand.

At a production facility, an operator was attempting to clear a jammed conveyor belt by hand when their left wrist became trapped between the moving rollers and the stationary frame of the machine. The injury caused moderate bruising and swelling on the affected area, but no fractures or lacerations were reported.

During a routine inspection on the conveyor belt system, an employee was tasked with clearing debris from a jammed section. While using a pry bar to dislodge the blockage, he lost his footing and fell onto the moving belt. His right arm became wedged between the machinery and the wall as he tried to regain balance, resulting in a deep laceration on his forearm that required immediate medical attention.

During maintenance operations on a 500-liter storage tank, an employee attempted to loosen a corroded valve using a socket wrench while standing at the side of the tank. As he applied force, his gloved hand slipped and became caught between the valve stem and the surrounding metal plate. The accident resulted in a deep laceration on the middle finger of his left hand, requiring medical attention but no surgical intervention was necessary.

During routine maintenance on a 10-ton overhead crane, an unexpected power surge caused the winch brake to fail, releasing a load of heavy steel beams onto the workshop floor. As the operator rushed to intervene, one beam fell and struck his right ankle with considerable force, causing a severe laceration that required immediate medical attention.

During the maintenance operation on a 12-inch pipeline in area B-5, around 08:30 hours, technician José Carlos attempted to loosen a stuck valve by applying excessive force with his left hand. As he did so, the valve suddenly yielded and swung back towards him, striking his ring finger against the metal housing of the valve stem. The impact caused a laceration requiring sutures and resulted in 4 points on the injury severity scale. José Carlos was transported to the hospital for treatment and released with no further restrictions after receiving medical clearance.

At 2:45 p.m., maintenance technician Mr. Patel was inspecting a faulty conveyor belt when he attempted to lift one of its idler rollers, catching his left thumb in the roller's gap and causing a deep laceration. He immediately reported the incident to the supervisor, who called for medical assistance as Mr. Patel applied pressure to the wound using his other hand.

During routine maintenance on conveyor belt 3, employee José was tasked with replacing a worn-out pulley system. As he reached for the replacement part, his gloved hand slipped off the railing and got caught in the moving belt's rollers, causing lacerations on his palm and index finger.

At approximately 2:45 pm on Level 4200 in Stop 1011, worker Pedro was performing a routine inspection of the conveyor belt when he noticed an unusual vibration coming from one of the pulleys. As he approached to investigate further, his safety boot slipped on a patch of oil that had leaked onto the floor, causing him to lose balance and fall against the moving belt. The impact caused his left hand to become trapped between the metal frame and the rotating drum, resulting in severe lacerations and bruising.

During a routine inspection on the upper level of the processing unit, technician Ana was examining the access hatch when it suddenly gave way under her weight, causing her right leg to become trapped between the broken metal frame and the concrete floor. As she tried to free herself, the heavy hatch cover fell from above, pinning her down further. Her colleague, Juan, rushed to assist but struggled to lift the massive structure due to its combined weight of 1,200 kg and the uneven terrain. Ana was eventually freed after a team of supervisors managed to secure the area and carefully remove the debris using specialized equipment.

At 9:15 a.m., during phase II of the production process, operator Rodriguez attempts to reposition the defective coil on the conveyor belt using a manual crane. As he pulls the coil towards him, it suddenly swings back and forth due to an imbalance in its weight distribution, striking his right elbow against the metal frame of the equipment. The impact causes a deep gash on the outer side of his elbow, prompting Rodriguez to seek immediate medical attention at the on-site infirmary.

During a routine maintenance check on the 345-RT-01 conveyor belt at approximately 2:15 p.m., operator Maria was attempting to adjust the tension pulley when her gloved hand slipped, causing her index finger to become pinched between the moving parts of the machinery. The injury resulted in minor lacerations and swelling, requiring immediate medical attention from on-site first responders before being transported to a nearby hospital for further treatment.

During a routine maintenance operation at 2:45 pm in Sector A of the Rio Verde mine site, operator Carlos attempted to adjust the tension on a conveyor belt while standing on a raised platform. As he manipulated the adjustment mechanism, his right foot slipped off the edge, causing him to lose balance and fall approximately two meters onto the concrete floor below. The impact resulted in a minor injury to his left ankle, which was treated at the site's first aid station before Carlos returned to work after receiving medical clearance.

During the operation of the overhead crane 03CR0123 at Stop 1234, Level 2400, a mechanical failure caused the hook to swing out of control, striking employee Carlos on his right shoulder and arm, resulting in lacerations requiring medical attention.

During a routine maintenance procedure on a conveyor belt system, an operator's right hand became entangled in a tangled web of twisted metal rebar protruding from the underside of the moving belt while attempting to clear debris. As he tried to free himself, his gloved fingers were pinched and crushed between two adjacent steel beams, resulting in severe bruising on multiple digits and minor lacerations.

At approximately 02:15 hours, during a routine maintenance operation on conveyor belt B-12 at the sorting facility, employee Maria Rodriguez was tasked with inspecting and cleaning a section of the machinery. As she leaned over the edge of the catwalk to access the area beneath, her gloved hand slipped off the railing due to excessive wear and tear. She lost balance and fell approximately 2 meters onto the moving conveyor belt, landing awkwardly on her right wrist and elbow. The impact caused a sharp pain in her arm, resulting in minor fractures and lacerations that required immediate medical attention.

In phase II, a technician was performing maintenance on a conveyor belt system while standing at a height of approximately 3 meters above ground level. The technician's left hand slipped off the railing and grasped for support as they lost their balance, causing them to fall backwards onto the moving conveyor belt. As they tried to regain control, their right arm became entangled in the chain links, resulting in severe bruising and lacerations on both arms. Additionally, a nearby storage bin of heavy machinery parts collapsed due to vibrations from the falling technician, striking another worker who was standing nearby with minor injuries.

At 9:10 a.m., an employee was performing routine maintenance on a conveyor belt when their gloved hand slipped, causing them to grasp the moving chain with both hands. The sudden stop of the chain resulted in severe bruising and lacerations to the palms of both hands, requiring immediate medical attention.

During routine maintenance on a conveyor belt in the production area of ​​a chemical plant at 14:15 hours, employee Maria, a mechanical technician, was attempting to tighten a loose bolt using a wrench when it slipped from her grasp and fell onto her right foot, causing minor bruising and swelling. The incident occurred without any immediate medical attention being required, but Maria did report the accident to management for documentation purposes only.

At approximately 02:15 hours, during a routine inspection in sector C-12, operator Leonardo Silva was examining the conveyor belt when he noticed an unusual vibration from one of the rollers. As he approached to investigate further, his colleague, engineer Carlos Santos, who was standing nearby, accidentally activated the adjacent roller's emergency stop mechanism. The sudden jolt caused Leonardo to lose balance and fall onto a sharp metal edge protruding from the machinery frame, resulting in a deep gash on his right palm.

During a routine maintenance operation on a conveyor belt system, an operator attempted to clear a jammed section by manually manipulating a metal plate using his right hand and left foot. As he was attempting to dislodge the blockage, the plate suddenly shifted and pinched the ring finger of his left hand between its edge and the surrounding structure, causing injury.

During maintenance work on a conveyor belt in Stop 1234, Level 4200, mechanic Carlos was performing welding tasks near an exposed electrical cable when it suddenly snapped and swung towards him. Reacting quickly, he managed to raise his arm just enough for the cable to strike his left forearm instead of his face or neck, causing a deep gash that required immediate medical attention.

During a routine maintenance operation on the conveyor belt system in the processing plant, an assistant attempts to adjust a loose screw on one of the rollers using a wrench with an extended handle (1.5 meters long). As he applies pressure, his hand slips and becomes wedged between the roller's metal casing and the adjacent stationary beam, causing lacerations to the palmar surface of his right hand. The assistant was wearing standard issue safety gloves at the time of the incident.

During maintenance operations on a conveyor belt system in the processing plant, an employee was inspecting a faulty section when a loose screw fell from above and lodged itself between his thumb and index finger of the right hand, causing significant discomfort and bleeding due to its sharp edge. The worker at the time wore safety glasses but not gloves, as he had forgotten them on the previous shift.

During the excavation process in a tunnel section, an operator was using a hydraulic hammer attached to a suspended platform at approximately 4 meters above ground level. While operating the hammer, he accidentally released the safety lock, allowing the tool to fall and strike him on the left shoulder, causing moderate bruising and lacerations. The impact also caused the platform's suspension cable to snap, resulting in it crashing onto the tunnel floor with considerable force.

During routine maintenance on a 12" diameter steel pipe, an employee attempted to loosen a stuck valve stem using a breaker bar attached to a socket wrench. As they applied force, the breaker bar suddenly slipped out of the socket and struck their right hand with considerable force, causing lacerations on the index finger and thumb. The injured worker was treated promptly by first aid responders and transported to a local hospital for further evaluation.

During a routine inspection on a 10-meter high scaffolding, an employee attempted to retrieve a lost tool from a narrow ledge while wearing standard issue gloves and safety harness. As he leaned forward, his right hand slipped off the edge of the platform and became wedged between the metal beam and the scaffolding's rail system. The sudden jerk caused a deep laceration on the palmar surface of his index finger, requiring immediate medical attention but not resulting in any permanent damage or long-term effects.

During maintenance work on conveyor belt 5 in the crushing plant, an employee was using a wrench to tighten a loose bolt when their gloved hand slipped and came into contact with the moving roller chain. The sudden impact caused lacerations on the index finger and thumb of the right hand, resulting in bleeding that required immediate medical attention.

During maintenance operations on a conveyor belt system, an employee was tasked with cleaning debris from beneath the idler rollers using a specialized tool attached to a long handle. As he maneuvered the tool in tight spaces, his right hand slipped and got caught between two adjacent rollers, causing lacerations on his index finger. The area around the accident site was well-lit at the time of the incident, and the employee wore standard issue work gloves with padding for protection.

At approximately 02:10 hours, Mr. Rodriguez, a maintenance technician, was inspecting the electrical panel of pump number 12 when he noticed an unusual noise coming from the motor compartment. As he leaned in closer to investigate, his sleeve got caught on the exposed wiring, causing him to lose balance and fall onto the metal floor plate. The impact resulted in severe bruising on Mr. Rodriguez's left shoulder and elbow areas.

At approximately 11:45 a.m., operator Ana Maria was conducting routine maintenance on conveyor belt C-12 when she accidentally dropped a wrench, which fell onto her left foot, causing crushing injuries due to its weight (approximately 2 kg) and the impact force upon landing. The supervisor, Juan Carlos, immediately rushed to assist Ana Maria, providing basic first aid before transporting her to the on-site medical center for further treatment.

Around 2:30 pm, during a routine maintenance operation on a conveyor belt system in sector C of the processing plant, José Silva, an experienced mechanic, was attempting to tighten a loose bolt when his left hand slipped and got caught between two adjacent rollers with a combined width of approximately 15 centimeters. The force exerted by the moving belts caused a deep laceration on the palmar surface of his index finger, requiring immediate medical attention at the plant's infirmary before being transferred to São Francisco Hospital for further treatment.

During maintenance operations on a conveyor belt in the production area, an employee attempted to remove a stuck screw from the system's frame using pliers while standing at the edge of the platform overlooking the machinery below. As he applied pressure with his hand, the screw suddenly gave way and fell onto the moving belt, striking the distal phalanx of the second finger on the right hand. The employee was wearing safety gloves (cut-resistant) but did not have a proper foothold at the time of the accident.

In circumstances where maintenance workers were performing routine checks on a 3-meter-long conveyor belt system, the injured technician was attempting to access a confined space beneath the belt by positioning himself at an angle of approximately 30 degrees from the floor. As he extended his right arm to reach for a loose screw, his hand slipped and became wedged between two adjacent rollers with a combined diameter of 15 centimeters. The immediate supervisor rushed to assist but was unable to free the trapped limb without causing further injury, prompting an emergency response team to be summoned from off-site.

During a routine inspection on an elevated walkway at a chemical plant, a worker accidentally dropped a 10-kilogram toolbox while attempting to adjust its strap. The tool fell onto his right hand, causing bruising and swelling of the fingers due to compression. Although wearing safety gloves, the impact was sufficient enough to warrant medical attention, resulting in a brief visit to an on-site first aid station for evaluation and treatment before returning to work with minimal disruption.

In the storage area 3456, around 08:30 hours, operator Jorge Morales was transferring a bundle of steel pipes (approximate weight 150 kg) from a pallet to a rack using an electric hoist. As he lifted the load, his right hand slipped off the control handle and became entangled in the pipe's wire mesh wrapping. The sudden jerk caused by releasing the hoist resulted in a deep laceration on Jorge's index finger, which required sutures at the medical center. He was treated and released for light duties after 24 hours of recovery.

During routine maintenance on a conveyor belt system, an employee attempted to clear a jammed pulley by manually rotating it while standing alongside the moving belt. As they reached for the jammed section, their gloved hand slipped and got caught between the pulley's rim and the surrounding casing, resulting in lacerations to the index finger and thumb of their dominant hand.

During the replacement of a worn-out conveyor belt on the processing plant's upper level, an operator attempts to lift a heavy metal bracket using a makeshift pulley system composed of a steel cable and two wooden blocks. As he strains to hoist the 20-kilogram bracket, his grip falters, causing it to fall onto his left hand, crushing three fingers against the concrete floor.

During a routine maintenance check on a conveyor belt system at the processing plant; while inspecting a faulty motor pulley, an operator's gloved hand slipped off the protective railing and got caught between the rotating drum and stationary frame of the machine, resulting in lacerations to the index finger. The injured employee was promptly treated by first responders and transported to the on-site medical center for further evaluation and treatment.

While performing routine maintenance on a conveyor belt system, an employee's gloved hand became trapped between two moving rollers when attempting to clear a blockage.
