The 3-inch diameter roller had dislodged from its mounting bracket due to worn-out bearings, causing it to shift and pin the victim's left index finger against the stationary frame of the machine.

During routine maintenance on a 24-inch pipe fitting, an employee's gloved hand slipped off the coupling while attempting to tighten it, causing his ring and pinky fingers of the right hand to be pinched by the mechanical grip. The subsequent release caused bruising and swelling in these digits.

During the operation of a conveyor belt system in an iron ore processing plant, two workers were tasked with clearing a jammed section by removing debris from beneath the moving belts. As they worked, one worker accidentally triggered the automatic start mechanism for the nearby crane, causing it to lower its hook unexpectedly and strike the other worker on the shoulder, resulting in minor bruising and lacerations. The injured worker was treated at the plant's medical center and released with minimal downtime required.

During a routine maintenance operation on the 3rd floor of the plant, an electrical technician was tasked with replacing a faulty circuit breaker in a live panel. As he reached for the replacement unit, his gloved hand slipped and grasped the exposed conductive bus bar instead, causing a sudden electric shock that threw him backward against the adjacent control cabinet. The impact resulted in a severe bruise on his left shoulder blade and minor lacerations on both palms from the broken glass of an overhead light fixture.

During a routine maintenance procedure on an overhead crane system, one worker was tasked with replacing a worn-out bearing assembly in a hoist motor unit. As he attempted to access the compartment containing the bearings, his left arm slipped and became entangled between the motor housing and the adjacent structural beam. The force of the entanglement caused bruising and swelling on the forearm, but no fracture was sustained. Both workers were wearing standard-issue safety gloves at the time of the accident.

During a routine maintenance procedure on a conveyor belt system, an employee was tasked with adjusting a pulley wheel assembly while standing at floor level. As they reached for a nearby wrench, their left hand slipped and became wedged between the moving pulley wheel's rotating drum and its stationary housing. The resulting crush injury caused bruising to the 2nd and 3rd fingers of the employee's left hand, with no reported fractures or lacerations at the time of incident.

During a scheduled shutdown for maintenance at approximately 02:15 hours, operator Maria was walking near the conveyor belt when she noticed an open gate on one of the chutes. As she approached to close it, the start-up sequence for that chute initiated unexpectedly, releasing a small rock (12x8x6cm) which hit the edge of the gate and ricocheted towards her direction, narrowly missing her face by 10 centimeters.

During a routine maintenance operation on conveyor belt 3, an employee attempted to clear a blockage using a mechanical scraper at approximately 14:30 hours. As they inserted the scraper into the jammed area, it suddenly released and swung back with considerable force, striking the worker's left forearm near the wrist, causing significant bruising and discomfort.

During a routine maintenance operation on an industrial conveyor belt system, a worker's right hand was caught between the moving pulley wheel and the stationary frame while attempting to clear a jammed material blockage. The employee wore standard issue safety gloves at the time of the accident, which helped reduce the severity of the injury. A minor laceration occurred on the palmar surface of the index finger, but no fracture or permanent damage was sustained.

At 2:15 p.m., a worker was performing maintenance on an electrical cabinet when their gloved hand slipped while tightening a loose screw, causing it to come into contact with a live terminal. The resulting electric shock caused minor burns and numbness in the affected finger, but no permanent damage or fracture was reported.

At 8:15 a.m., while performing routine maintenance on a conveyor belt system, an employee's sleeve became caught in the moving chain drive, causing lacerations on his left forearm and wrist. The employee managed to free himself with assistance from coworkers but required medical attention for further treatment.

At 9:15 a.m., while performing maintenance on the conveyor belt, the mechanic's right sleeve gets caught in the rotating drum of the cleaning system. As he tries to free his arm, the fabric tears and cuts his wrist, requiring immediate medical attention. The work area was well lit with adequate ventilation at the time of the accident.

During maintenance operations in the mechanical workshop at FERREIRA METALURGICA LTDA, a technician attempted to remove a stuck piston from a hydraulic press using an adjustable wrench while standing on a metal catwalk 2 meters above the floor. As he applied force, the piston suddenly released and struck him on the left shoulder, causing a severe bruise and minor lacerations. The technician was wearing safety glasses and a hard hat at the time of the accident but did not have any additional personal protective equipment (PPE) beyond that.

During a routine maintenance procedure on a conveyor belt system at an iron ore processing plant, a worker's gloved hand got caught between two moving rollers while attempting to clear a blockage caused by accumulated debris. The victim's arm was pinched for approximately 10 seconds before they managed to free themselves with the help of their colleague, sustaining minor injuries including bruising and swelling on their wrist and forearm.

During a routine inspection of the conveyor belt system in the processing area, an unexpected mechanical failure caused the idler roller 345-B-12A to dislodge from its mounting bracket and fall onto the operating floor, striking employee Juanita on her right shoulder, resulting in minor lacerations.

During a routine inspection of the conveyor belt system at the processing plant, an employee from the company TECNOPROX was tasked with replacing a faulty motor bearing on one of the drive units. As he gained access to the unit by climbing up the ladder attached to it, his safety harness became entangled in the mechanical components above him. Suddenly, the conveyor belt started moving at high speed due to an electrical malfunction, causing the employee's body to be pulled towards the rotating drum with a diameter of 2 meters and a height of approximately 1 meter. The drum had sharp edges and protrusions that caused severe lacerations on his arms, legs, and torso before he managed to free himself from the entanglement. Despite wearing safety glasses and gloves, the employee suffered multiple injuries requiring immediate medical attention, including deep gashes, bruising, and possible internal damage.

At 2:15 p.m., during a routine inspection of the conveyor belt system, an employee noticed excessive vibrations emanating from one of the idler rollers. Upon closer examination, it was discovered that the roller's shaft had become loose and began to wobble uncontrollably. The worker attempted to secure the roller manually but accidentally triggered the emergency stop mechanism, causing a sudden jolt that sent him stumbling backward. In his haste to regain balance, he lost grip on his hard hat, which fell from a height of approximately 1 meter and struck his left temple with moderate force.

During a routine maintenance operation on Stop 1234, Level 4200, worker Kaelin was involved in an incident while replacing a faulty conveyor belt pulley system. As he attempted to lift the heavy motor housing with his coworkers' assistance, it suddenly detached from its mounting bracket and fell approximately two meters onto their collective heads, causing multiple injuries including lacerations on both hands and a severe concussion for Kaelin.

During routine maintenance activity on conveyor belt 3 at the processing plant, an employee was attempting to remove a stuck chunk of material from the belt's rollers using a pry bar when it suddenly gave way and struck his right index finger, causing moderate bruising and swelling. The injured worker received medical attention on-site before being cleared to return to work later that day without further incident.

During the replacement of a faulty conveyor belt on production line 3, technicians Carlos and Ana were instructed by their supervisor, Jorge, to lift and position the new belt onto the rollers. As they worked together, Ana lifted one end of the belt while Carlos held the other, with approximately half of it suspended in mid-air. In an effort to reposition the belt for assembly, Ana lost her grip on the elevated portion, causing it to fall and strike her left hand against a metal beam, resulting in lacerations.

During a routine inspection on the upper level of the processing plant, maintenance worker Diego is instructed by his supervisor, Jorge, to investigate an unusual noise emanating from one of the conveyor belts. As he approaches the affected area, two colleagues - Juan and Carlos - are simultaneously operating heavy-duty machinery nearby, unaware of Diego's presence. Suddenly, a loose bolt on the machinery falls 2 meters onto the floor, striking Diego with great force and imprisoning his right hand against the metal surface.

In Stop 4321, Level 2500, drilling assistant Carlos Mendes was performing a routine maintenance check on the drill bit during a shift change at approximately 08:45 hours. While examining the bit's surface, his gloved hand accidentally slipped off and got caught between the rotating shaft and the casing, causing a deep laceration to his index finger. The injury required immediate medical attention, and Carlos was transported to the on-site infirmary for treatment.

During a routine inspection on the conveyor belt system, an employee accidentally triggered the automatic start-up mechanism while trying to clear a jammed section of debris. The suddenly activated machinery caused a metal plate to swing out and strike the worker's right shoulder with moderate force, resulting in bruising but no reported fractures or serious injuries requiring immediate medical attention.

During a routine maintenance check on a conveyor belt in the processing area, an employee attempted to dislodge a stuck object by inserting their right hand into the gap between two moving rollers. The object suddenly shifted and pinched the ring finger of the employee's dominant hand, causing minor bruising and swelling.

At 14:10 hours, during a routine maintenance operation on the conveyor belt system at Plant A-12, an employee was attempting to adjust a loose screw when his gloved hand slipped and came into contact with a rotating drum's edge, causing lacerations on the index finger of his right hand. The injured worker received medical attention from the site first aid team before being transported to a nearby hospital for further treatment and release.

During a maintenance operation on a 12-meter-long conveyor belt, an employee was tasked with replacing a worn-out roller bearing at its midpoint. As he lifted the heavy component from the floor, his grip slipped and it fell onto his left hand, causing crushing injuries to the thumb and index finger due to the significant weight of approximately 25 kilograms. The injured worker immediately reported the incident to their supervisor and was transported to the on-site medical center for treatment.

During a routine maintenance operation on a conveyor belt system, an employee accidentally triggered the start-up sequence while attempting to access a confined space beneath the machinery. A loose metal plate, measuring approximately 30x20cm in size, was dislodged and fell from the upper platform, striking the worker's shoulder with moderate force. The impact caused bruising but no fractures were reported after external medical attention was provided on-site.

During a routine maintenance operation on a conveyor belt system, an employee's gloved hand slipped off the guardrail while attempting to clear debris from the belting surface. The sudden loss of traction caused their left wrist and forearm to be pinched between the moving belt and a stationary frame component, resulting in minor lacerations and bruising.

During a routine maintenance operation on a 300-ton overhead crane, an employee attempted to loosen a stuck pulley wheel by inserting his gloved hand into the gap between the wheel and its housing. As he applied pressure, one of the surrounding bolts suddenly shifted, causing the wheel to rotate unexpectedly and trapping his wrist against the housing's edge.

During a routine maintenance operation on the conveyor belt system in sector 3; after having removed a faulty idler roller from its mounting bracket, the technician positions himself between the stationary rollers and the motorized drive unit to inspect the surrounding area for any potential hazards. At that moment, an unsecured cable (diameter 1 cm, length 2 meters) lying on the floor gets entangled around his right ankle, causing him to lose balance and fall onto a sharp metal edge protruding from the belt frame (approximate height of 5 centimeters). The technician was wearing steel-toed boots at the time of the accident.

During maintenance operations on a conveyor belt in sector 3 of the processing plant, an employee suffered injuries when his right hand became entangled in a malfunctioning pulley system while attempting to free a jammed section of belt. The sudden release of tension caused by the worker's efforts resulted in severe lacerations and bruising to his hand and wrist.

During a maintenance operation on a conveyor belt system, an employee was attempting to clear a blockage in one of its sections by hand when their right arm became entangled between two adjacent rollers. As they tried to free themselves, the rollers rotated and caused friction burns on the outer forearm, resulting in minor bruising but no fractures. The worker wore long-sleeved clothing at the time of the incident.

During routine maintenance on a 24-inch pipe section, an employee's gloved hand slipped while tightening a bolted connection, resulting in their left wrist being pinched between the pipe and the adjacent structure. The incident caused bruising and swelling around the affected area, but no fractures or permanent damage were reported.

At 02:10 hours, operator Maria was performing a routine inspection on the conveyor belt when she accidentally triggered the emergency stop button while trying to clear a jammed section. The sudden halt caused a loose bolt from one of the nearby machinery components to roll off and strike her left ankle, resulting in a minor laceration requiring immediate medical attention.

At approximately 14:30 hours, a worker was attempting to clear a clogged conveyor belt in a manufacturing facility by using a long-handled brush with a metal shaft (2 meters long and 3 cm diameter). As the worker leaned over the belt to reach the obstruction, their arm slipped off the railing and became entangled between the moving rollers and the stationary frame of the machine. The forceful movement caused a deep laceration on the forearm, requiring immediate medical attention. At the time of the accident, the worker was wearing cotton gloves for grip protection but not protective sleeves or long-sleeved shirts to prevent exposure to potential hazards.

During routine maintenance on a conveyor belt system; an operator attempts to clear a blockage by inserting their right hand into the narrow gap between two adjacent rollers, unaware of the sharp metal edge protruding from one of them. As they push against the obstruction with their fingers, the edge slices through the palmar surface, causing significant bleeding and prompting immediate medical attention.

During the replacement of a worn-out gear on a conveyor belt system in an iron ore processing plant, the operator attempted to align two adjacent gears using a socket wrench while standing on a raised platform approximately 1 meter above ground level. As he applied pressure to turn one of the gears, his gloved hand slipped off the handle and became caught between the rotating gear and the stationary frame, resulting in a deep laceration on the palmar surface of his left hand. The operator immediately ceased work and reported the incident to their supervisor before seeking medical attention at the company's on-site clinic for treatment and evaluation.

During a routine maintenance operation on Stop 1234, Level 4200, worker Carlos was tasked with inspecting the vent pipe of an extractor fan. As he climbed onto the equipment's platform using his safety harness and handrails, one of the handrails suddenly gave way due to wear and tear, causing him to lose balance and fall approximately 1.5 meters to the floor. The impact resulted in a deep laceration on Carlos' left forearm and minor bruising on both knees.

During the installation of a conveyor belt system in the production area, an employee was tasked with securing loose wires near the motorized pulley wheel. As he reached for a wire bundle, his gloved hand slipped off the metal frame and got caught between the rotating drum and the stationary housing. The sudden force caused a deep laceration on the palmar surface of his left hand, requiring immediate medical attention.

During a routine maintenance operation on the 12-inch HDPE pipe, an employee approached from below to supervise the work while four colleagues above were manipulating the "T" fitting to secure flanges of the same pipe and adjacent PVC conduit (14 inches in diameter). Unbeknownst to them, the PVC pipe had become dislodged from its support due to accumulated fine tailings material weighing approximately 700 kg. As it fell two meters to the floor, it rebounded and struck one worker standing at ground level with sufficient force to cause injury, requiring external medical attention; however, no fracture was detected during examination.

During maintenance operations on a conveyor belt at the processing plant, an employee was tasked with replacing worn-out rollers while standing in the walkway between two sections of the belt. As he reached for a replacement roller, his gloved hand slipped and grasped a loose bolt that had fallen from one of the nearby pulleys. The sudden jerk caused him to lose balance and fall onto the moving conveyor belt, which was operating at a moderate speed. His left arm became entangled in the metal mesh guarding the rollers as he slid towards the idler pulley. Although wearing safety glasses and earplugs, his head struck the edge of the walkway's railing with sufficient force to cause concussion symptoms. The employee suffered multiple contusions on both arms and minor abrasions due to friction against the conveyor belt surface.

During a routine maintenance operation in the mechanical workshop at 14:20 hours, employee Carlos Silva attempted to loosen a stubborn bolt on an industrial press using a wrench. As he applied excessive force, the handle of the wrench slipped from his grasp and struck his left index finger, causing a deep laceration that required immediate medical attention. The injured worker was transported to São Paulo Hospital for treatment and subsequent release with no further complications or lost time at work.

During a routine inspection in the storage area at Petrobras' Refinery 2, an employee named Carlos attempted to retrieve a heavy steel beam from a shelf using a pulley system. As he was lifting the beam, it suddenly slipped and fell onto his right forearm, causing a moderate laceration and bruising. The injured worker was treated on-site by first responders before being transported to Hospital São Francisco for further evaluation and treatment.

At approximately 8:15 a.m., during maintenance operations on the conveyor belt system in the production area of Plant XYZ, two technicians, Juan and Carlos, were attempting to replace a faulty gearbox component. As they lifted the heavy part into position, it suddenly slipped from their grasp and fell three meters onto the concrete floor, striking the left ankle of technician Maria who was standing nearby, causing significant injury.

During a routine maintenance operation at the Petroquímica plant, an employee slipped on oil spills on the catwalk while walking towards the C-101 reactor. As he lost balance, his hand grasped for support and ended up getting caught in the rotating shaft of a nearby pump, causing severe lacerations to his left forearm. The injured worker was rushed to the hospital's emergency room where he underwent immediate surgical intervention.

During maintenance activities in the 3rd stage of the sulfuric acid production process at Petroquimica plant, a worker was inspecting and cleaning the upper section of a vertical pipe (ID: 10 cm, length: 5 meters) using an extension ladder with three rungs. The worker's left foot slipped off the top rung while attempting to reach a stubborn stain on the pipe wall, causing them to fall approximately 2.4 meters to the ground below and landing awkwardly on their right ankle.

In section 42 at row 8 Cell 21, a worker is performing maintenance on a conveyor belt when they lose their footing and fall into an open pit approximately 1 meter deep due to uneven flooring. The impact causes severe bruising on the right shoulder and wrist, requiring immediate medical attention.

At 14:20 hours, Mr. Rodriguez attempts to retrieve a dropped wrench from an elevated platform while performing maintenance on the conveyor belt system. He loses his footing and falls approximately 3.5 meters, landing awkwardly on his right shoulder and upper arm. The impact causes significant trauma and bruising in these areas.

ACTIVITY: pipe welding (installation of a 12-inch pipeline) LOCAL: onshore oil platform, Module A-23 The welder was performing pipe welding when an unexpected pressure surge caused by a nearby pumping operation released hot gas and sparks onto the work area. Two workers in close proximity suffered severe burns and were immediately transported to the on-site medical center for treatment before being airlifted to a specialized burn unit at a local hospital.

During routine maintenance on a conveyor belt system at the manufacturing facility, two technicians were tasked with inspecting and replacing worn-out rollers. One technician climbed onto the moving conveyor belt using an unsecured ladder while his colleague handed him tools from below. As they worked together, the ladder suddenly gave way, causing the technician to fall approximately 2 meters to the floor, landing awkwardly on his right ankle.

At approximately 9:15 am, during a routine maintenance operation on the conveyor belt system in the crushing department of Quarry XYZ, operator Carlos reported an unexpected jam at the primary crusher feed point to his supervisor, Roberto. In response, Roberto instructed Carlos to shut down the feeder and initiate emergency procedures for clearing the blockage. As Carlos attempted to access the affected area, a loose section of the vibrating screen gave way, releasing a cascade of heavy metal fragments that struck him with significant force, causing severe injuries to his upper body.

At 08:20 hours in the storage area of the Company Minerales y Metales S.A., located on level -50 of the La Rinconada ramp, a worker was attempting to retrieve a heavy steel drum (diameter 60 cm / Height 80 cm / Weight 120 kg) that had fallen from an overhead rack. As he reached for the drum with his right hand, it suddenly rolled off the floor and struck him on the left leg, causing a severe injury requiring immediate medical attention.

In section 34 on row 9 Cell 42, a maintenance worker is performing electrical testing on a faulty circuit breaker when an unexpected surge occurs, causing him to lose his footing and fall approximately three meters onto a metal grating surface. The impact results in severe bruising of the left shoulder blade and temporary loss of sensation in the fingers due to compression against the floor. Worker was seen by medical personnel and transported to a nearby clinic for further evaluation.

At 09:45 hours, Mr. Juan Sanchez was performing routine maintenance on a steam turbine's governor assembly when his gloved hand slipped off the exposed shaft while tightening a bolt. As he attempted to regain balance, his arm got caught in the rotating fan blades of the adjacent condenser unit, causing severe lacerations and bruising to his left forearm before he could free himself.

During maintenance on a 12-meter-high conveyor belt at Station 1200 of the Open Pit Mine, worker Juan was inspecting the upper section when he accidentally dismounted the safety harness and fell approximately 3 meters onto the moving belt's return idler roller, causing severe injuries to his left leg.

During a routine maintenance check on the conveyor belt system at the processing plant, an employee was tasked with inspecting a malfunctioning idler roller. While attempting to access the underside of the roller, their safety harness became entangled in the pulley mechanism, causing them to fall approximately 3 meters from the catwalk railing and land awkwardly on their right shoulder.

During maintenance operations on a high-voltage electrical substation, an electrician attempted to access a confined space within the transformer housing while wearing inadequate personal protective equipment (PPE). As he leaned forward to inspect the internal components, his left arm made contact with a live 12kV conductor, causing a sudden and intense electrical discharge that threw him backward. The operator suffered severe burns on both arms and legs, as well as lacerations from falling against sharp metal edges within the enclosure.

At 09:15 hours in area B-12, a maintenance worker is performing electrical testing on equipment when they accidentally touch exposed live wires while attempting to clear debris from the control panel. The shock causes them to lose balance and fall onto the metal floor grating, suffering an injury to their left ankle that requires medical attention.

At 14:45 on February 12th, operator Maria is performing a routine inspection of tank T-3456 in the chemical processing area when she accidentally knocks over a 20-liter container of concentrated sodium hydroxide solution while attempting to retrieve a dropped tool from an elevated platform. The spilled liquid flows down the stairs and onto the floor, causing her left foot to slip on the slippery surface. As Maria tries to regain balance, she falls backwards against a nearby railing, resulting in a fracture of the fifth metatarsal bone in her right ankle. She is immediately taken to the hospital for medical treatment and undergoes surgery requiring 12 stitches. The incident causes an estimated 2-hour delay in production due to containment procedures and cleanup efforts.

At 14:22 hours in section B-3, a worker was operating a forklift (model FLC-500) transporting a pallet of chemicals when it collided with an overhead pipe crane, causing the forks to detach and strike the operator's left leg at a height of approximately 1.5 meters. The impact resulted in severe lacerations and fractures requiring immediate medical attention.

At approximately 9:15 a.m., maintenance worker Maria approaches the electrical panel in the plant's basement to investigate an alarm signal. As she reaches for the circuit breaker, her gloved hand makes contact with a live wire that has been exposed due to recent repairs. The resulting electric shock causes her to fall backwards onto the concrete floor, suffering severe burns and lacerations on her hands and arms.

During a routine maintenance procedure at the company's processing unit 3, technician Jorge failed to secure the upper flange of the centrifuge before attempting to remove it from its stand. As he lifted the heavy component, the unbalanced weight caused the entire assembly to swing violently, striking him on the right side of his head and shoulder area. The impact resulted in a severe laceration requiring 15 stitches at the hospital, where Jorge was treated for his injuries. He will be out of commission for two weeks due to the severity of the wound.

During a routine inspection on level 420 of the underground mine, operator Carlos descended from an elevated walkway to access a maintenance area. As he landed on the floor, his foot slipped on grease residue and he fell approximately 2 meters onto a concrete surface. The impact caused luxo-fractures in both ankles and bruising on the left hip. First aid was administered by colleagues before Carlos was transported to the mine's infirmary for further treatment.

During a routine maintenance operation on the conveyor belt system at the processing plant's south wing, a technician attempted to dislodge a stuck screwdriver lodged in a gear assembly while it was still energized. As he inserted his right hand into the gap between the gears and the motor housing, his gloved fingers made contact with an exposed electrical wire, causing a 120V shock that resulted in severe burns on three of his fingertips.

At approximately 9:15 am, during a routine maintenance operation on the conveyor belt system in Sector B of the coal mine, worker José was attempting to loosen a stubborn bolt using an adjustable wrench when his gloved hand slipped off and he fell onto the moving belt. As he struggled to regain balance, his right arm became entangled in the meshing mechanism, causing severe lacerations on his forearm and wrist. The conveyor belt's sudden stop due to José's entrapment resulted in a minor spill of coal dust at the adjacent transfer point.

During a routine maintenance operation at the 345-meter level of the São Francisco mine, an employee working for Mineração Brasil Sul was attempting to loosen a stuck pulley wheel on a conveyor belt using a hydraulic jack and socket wrench when it suddenly gave way, causing him to lose his balance and fall onto the moving belt. The impact resulted in severe bruising and lacerations on both legs, as well as a suspected fracture of the right tibia.

At approximately 8:15 am, during a routine maintenance operation on the centrifuge C-12, engineer Maria noticed an unusual vibration coming from the machine's motor while attempting to replace a worn-out bearing. She quickly notified her supervisor, Jorge, who immediately stopped the machinery and initiated shutdown procedures. However, before they could safely exit the area, a sudden mechanical failure caused the centrifuge's rotor to dislodge, striking engineer Maria on the right side of her head with considerable force, causing the described injury.

ACTIVITY: maintenance on a gas pipeline LOCAL: industrial area, sector 3 The operator attempted to repair a leak in a 12-inch pipe when a sudden pressure surge caused by faulty valves led to an explosion. A piece of debris from the blast struck the victim's arm, causing severe lacerations and fractures. Emergency responders arrived promptly and transported him to the hospital for further treatment.

At 08:15 hours in the storage area of the processing plant at Level -2000 West Ramp, worker Juan Sanchez was removing a heavy steel plate (120 kg) from a stack using a manual fork lift when it suddenly fell off, striking his right shoulder and causing an injury to the surrounding tissue.

At approximately 14:45 hours in sector C-3, a mechanical failure occurred on the overhead crane during maintenance operations. The safety latch malfunctioned, causing the load (a 2-tonne steel beam) to fall onto the operator's left shoulder and arm, resulting in severe injuries. The worker was immediately transported to the on-site medical center for emergency treatment before being transferred to a nearby hospital for further evaluation and care.

During a routine maintenance operation on a 10-meter-long conveyor belt at an iron ore processing facility, two workers were suspended from a cherry picker basket elevated approximately 5 meters above ground level. One worker was attempting to remove debris lodged between the belt's rollers when his gloved hand became entangled in the moving machinery, causing severe lacerations and crushing injuries to his left forearm.

During the maintenance cycle at the conveyor belt system; while checking a faulty roller bearing, the technician failed to notice an open pit ahead and lost balance when trying to step around it, resulting in falling into the 3-meter-deep trench and sustaining injuries from the impact on the concrete floor.

ACTIVITY: pipe inspection LOCAL: offshore oil rig, platform 12 The technician was conducting a routine pipe inspection when he slipped on an oily surface and fell approximately 10 meters onto a metal grating. He suffered severe injuries and was airlifted to the nearest medical center for emergency treatment.

ACTIVITY: pipe welding LOCAL: offshore oil rig, platform 3 The welder was connecting a section of pipeline when it suddenly ruptured due to internal pressure buildup. A flying piece of metal struck him on the left side of his head and torso, causing severe lacerations and bruising. He fell onto the catwalk, where he lay unconscious until rescued by colleagues who immediately called for medical assistance and transported him to a nearby hospital for further treatment.

At approximately 8:20 a.m., during routine maintenance operations in sector C-4, José Luis Torres, a mechanical technician, was attempting to access the upper level of a storage tank using an industrial staircase with handrails and footholds. As he ascended, his right foot slipped from its footing due to grease accumulation on the surface, causing him to lose balance and fall approximately 3 meters onto the concrete floor below, resulting in injury.

During a routine maintenance operation on Unit 12 at the processing facility, an equipment malfunction occurred when Operator 345 attempted to repair a faulty conveyor belt by accessing the control panel of the adjacent crusher unit (Model CR-1234). Unbeknownst to the operator, the safety interlock mechanism had been compromised due to recent modifications. As Operator 345 adjusted the settings on the control panel, an unexpected surge in power caused the crusher's rotating drum to suddenly engage, resulting in a severe laceration injury to their left hand and arm. The incident occurred at approximately 14:45 hours with no other personnel present within close proximity of the equipment.

ACTIVITY: Maintenance on conveyor belt LOCAL: Underground mine, level 220 - section B The maintenance worker was inspecting a faulty idler pulley when it suddenly failed, causing a chain reaction that led to the collapse of a nearby support beam. As debris fell from above, the operator suffered severe lacerations and fractures while attempting to escape the area.

During maintenance operations on a 2-meter-long steel beam suspended at an altitude of 4.5 meters from the ground, two workers were involved in lifting and securing it for welding repairs. One worker, who was standing on a mobile scaffolding platform, attempted to guide the beam into position using a hydraulic jack, but lost control as the beam suddenly shifted due to uneven weight distribution. The steel beam fell 2.3 meters onto his left shoulder, causing an injury to the clavicle and shoulder blade.

During maintenance operations on a conveyor belt in the processing area, an employee's safety harness failed while working at heights, causing them to fall 4 meters onto a metal grating floor with a concrete surface. The impact resulted in severe lacerations and bruising of the back and head, requiring immediate medical attention and subsequent hospitalization for further treatment.

During a routine maintenance operation at the coal conveyor belt in section 3B, an electrician was performing electrical testing on a faulty motor when it suddenly malfunctioned and exploded, throwing sparks and debris towards him. The incident caused severe burns on his left arm and shoulder area, requiring immediate medical attention.

During a routine inspection in sector 3A, an employee attempts to access the upper platform by climbing up the ladder while carrying a toolbox. As he reaches for handrails at approximately 2 meters from ground level, his right foot slips off the rung and hangs precariously over the edge. Despite grabbing onto the railing with both hands, he loses balance and falls about 1 meter to the floor below, landing awkwardly on his left shoulder and injuring it severely enough to warrant immediate medical attention.

At 13:20 hours, a worker was performing maintenance on a conveyor belt when his hand slipped from the safety harness while adjusting a loose bolt, causing him to fall approximately 3 meters and land awkwardly on his left side, resulting in severe bruising and lacerations that required immediate medical attention.

At approximately 2:15 p.m., in circumstances where the electrician Juan was attempting to replace a faulty circuit breaker on a live panel, he inadvertently triggered an electrical arc flash while handling a nearby wire bundle (30cm x 20cm; 1.5 kg). The sudden discharge of energy propelled the wire bundle upwards with considerable force, striking Juan's right shoulder and causing him to lose balance. As he stumbled backwards, his left hand grasped for support on a metal railing approximately 2 meters off the ground, but it gave way under his weight, resulting in a fall from that height onto the concrete floor below.

At approximately 2:15 p.m., during a routine maintenance operation on Level 2100 OB3A of the mining facility, Foreman Juan Perez was inspecting the Atlas truck parked near the drilling platform when he failed to notice that the safety latch had been disengaged. As he approached the vehicle, it suddenly lurched forward due to an unsecured load, pinning his left arm against the metal frame and causing severe lacerations. The incident occurred in a high-traffic area with inadequate lighting conditions, further complicating the rescue efforts.

At approximately 3:15 p.m., operator Maria was performing routine maintenance on a conveyor belt in the processing area of Plant B when she lost her footing and fell from an elevation of about 1.5 meters onto a metal grating, which caused her left ankle to twist abnormally, resulting in a severe sprain and bruising.

In section 23 of the chemical processing area, a worker was performing routine maintenance on a heat exchanger while standing atop a 3-meter-high platform ladder. While attempting to loosen a stuck bolt with a wrench, the worker lost their balance and fell off the ladder, landing awkwardly on their right shoulder and elbow. The impact caused significant trauma to both joints, resulting in severe bruising, swelling, and lacerations that required immediate medical attention.

During a routine maintenance operation on conveyor belt 345 at level -1200 Acc 5, an electrician is tasked with replacing a faulty motor control unit located approximately 2 meters above ground level. The worker uses a ladder to access the area and begins removing screws from the existing housing when suddenly one of the screws falls out, striking him in the right hand causing lacerations and bruising.

At 14:20 hours, José Morales attempts to retrieve a dropped tool from an elevated platform by climbing onto a stack of crates, which suddenly collapses under his weight due to instability caused by uneven loading and excessive height. As the crates fall, they strike Morales with considerable force on the left side of his torso, resulting in severe injuries.

At 10:20 hours, Engineer Rodriguez was conducting a routine inspection on Level -1200 OB1A when he climbed onto the catwalk connecting two modules of the processing unit. As he approached the midpoint, his footing slipped and he fell approximately 3 meters, striking his head against a metal beam before landing on the platform below. He was immediately attended to by coworkers who transported him to the medical center for treatment.

At 14:20 hours, a worker is injured while attempting to retrieve a fallen object from an elevated platform (2.5 meters above ground) using a pulley system and rope sling. As he reaches for the object, his hand slips off the rope and hits the edge of the platform, causing a deep laceration on his left palm. The worker was immediately treated by first aid responders and transported to a nearby medical center for further evaluation and treatment.

At approximately 2:10 p.m. on 02/14/19, operator Maria Rodriguez falls from a ladder while performing maintenance work on pipe P-1234 in the chemical processing unit of the refinery. The fall occurs when she loses her footing due to slippery conditions and lands awkwardly on her right ankle, causing a severe fracture with displacement.

During a routine maintenance operation on the 12-inch diameter steam pipeline at the thermal power plant, a worker was struck by falling debris after a sudden burst of pressure caused a section of piping to rupture and fall from an elevated platform. The impact resulted in severe lacerations to his left leg and shoulder area.

During maintenance operations on a large-scale conveyor belt system, an employee was struck by a falling 50-kilogram metal plate after it became dislodged from its securing mechanism due to improper tightening of bolts. The impact occurred when the worker attempted to retrieve the loose plate, resulting in severe lacerations and bruising to their left arm and shoulder area.

At 09:30 hours, José Luis Gómez-RAMÍREZ was performing maintenance tasks on a conveyor belt when he accidentally got his gloved hand caught in a moving pulley system. As he tried to free himself, the machine jerked violently, causing him to lose balance and fall onto the concrete floor from an approximate height of 1 meter. He suffered severe bruising and lacerations on both arms and was transported to the hospital for immediate medical attention.

During a routine maintenance operation on the conveyor belt system at level -3456 Acc 12, the technician climbed onto the moving section of the belt to access the drive motor. While attempting to loosen a bolt with his left hand, he lost balance and fell off the side of the belt as it was still in motion. His right arm got caught between two adjacent rollers, causing severe lacerations on both arms. The incident occurred at approximately 2:45 pm, when the conveyor belt was running at a speed of about 4 meters per second, according to the INTHINC report.

On August 12th at 14:45 hours, during a routine maintenance operation in the storage room of the manufacturing facility, worker Juan Hernandez was attempting to loosen a stuck valve using an adjustable wrench while standing on a metal platform elevated approximately 1.5 meters above the floor. As he applied additional force, his right foot slipped off the edge and he fell onto the concrete surface below, landing awkwardly with his left arm extended in attempt to break his fall. The impact caused luxo-fractures in his wrist and minor bruising on his elbow.

On August 12th at approximately 3:45 pm, operator Juan Carlos is tasked with performing routine maintenance on a piping system in Sector B-1234 of the processing plant. As he climbs down from the access ladder onto the platform surrounding tank T-5678, his gloved hand slips off the rung due to excessive sweat caused by high ambient temperature and humidity. He falls 3 meters to the concrete floor below, landing awkwardly on his right shoulder, causing a comminuted fracture of the humerus bone.

During maintenance operations on a 2-meter-long conveyor belt at approximately 8:15 am, three workers from the production team were present in the area. Worker Juan was tasked with replacing worn-out rollers while his colleagues, Maria and Carlos, monitored the process remotely via CCTV cameras. As Juan lifted one of the heavy rollers to install it onto the moving belt, he lost balance due to an uneven surface and accidentally dropped it 1.5 meters from a scaffolding platform. The roller fell onto Juan's left leg, causing severe bruising and lacerations.

During maintenance operations on a conveyor belt system, an employee was tasked with replacing a worn-out pulley wheel. The worker climbed onto the moving section of the belt and positioned himself near the malfunctioning component when it suddenly gave way, causing the entire assembly to collapse. A large metal plate (30cmx20cm; 12Kg) detached from the structure and fell approximately 4 meters, striking the employee's right shoulder with considerable force, resulting in a severe injury.

At approximately 8:20 a.m., during routine maintenance on conveyor belt 12 at the packaging facility, an electrician attempts to access a confined space beneath the machinery by removing a section of grating (40 x 80 cm). Unbeknownst to him, two nearby technicians are preparing to lift heavy equipment into position. As they begin their task, one technician's foot slips off the edge of the raised platform, and he falls approximately 30 cm onto his right ankle, causing an injury due to the unexpected drop.

During a routine maintenance operation on a 12-inch pipeline at the refinery's north wing, employee Maria Silva accidentally activated the wrong valve while attempting to isolate a section of pipe for welding repairs. The sudden pressure surge caused by the incorrect valve opening led to a catastrophic failure of the adjacent piping segment, resulting in a high-pressure gas release and subsequent explosion that shattered nearby windows and damaged surrounding equipment. Maria was thrown several feet away from the blast site, suffering severe lacerations on her left arm requiring 15 stitches at the hospital.

At approximately 11:20 pm, during a routine maintenance check on the B-12 pipeline, technician Carlos noticed an unusual vibration coming from one of the pumps. As he approached the pump for further inspection, his foot slipped on the oily surface and became trapped in a narrow gap between two metal plates. The sudden movement caused by the pump's malfunction resulted in severe lacerations to Carlos' leg, requiring immediate medical attention.

At 03:42 a.m., Mr. Rodriguez is attempting to secure a loose cable on the upper catwalk of the production facility when it suddenly snaps, striking him in the right shoulder and causing an immediate injury. The force of impact causes him to lose his balance, resulting in a fall from approximately 4 meters onto the concrete floor below, further exacerbating the severity of the incident.

At 11:20 hours, Juan Sanchez was performing routine maintenance on a malfunctioning conveyor belt when he accidentally got his safety harness entangled in its moving parts. As he tried to free himself, the belt jerked him forward, causing him to lose balance and fall approximately 3 meters onto an exposed metal beam, resulting in severe lacerations and bruising.

At approximately 14:30 hours, during a routine maintenance operation on the conveyor belt system at the Company's warehouse in São Paulo, employee Carlos attempted to adjust a malfunctioning pulley wheel while standing atop a steel ladder. As he leaned forward to access the mechanism, his foot slipped off the rung and he fell three meters onto the concrete floor below, landing awkwardly with his right shoulder taking the brunt of the impact. Medical examination revealed a severe fracture of the humerus requiring immediate surgical intervention at a nearby hospital.

During maintenance operations on a 150-ton overhead crane at the steel fabrication facility, electrician Juan attempted to replace a faulty contactor in the control panel while the crane was still energized. As he removed the cover plate, his gloved hand made accidental contact with an exposed live conductor, causing a spark that ignited nearby flammable materials stored on shelves above. The resulting explosion and fireball engulfed Juan's upper body, inflicting severe burns to his face, neck, and arms.

ACTIVITY: pipeline maintenance (hot tapping) LOCAL: offshore oil platform, module 3 - deck level B-1 The technician was performing hot tapping on a corroded pipe when a sudden pressure surge caused the pipe to burst, releasing high-pressure steam that struck him from behind. He suffered severe burns and lacerations before being rescued by colleagues and airlifted to the nearest hospital for emergency treatment.

At 2:10 pm, maintenance technician Carlos is tasked with inspecting a faulty conveyor belt on production floor C-3. He climbs onto the moving equipment to access the damaged section and becomes entangled in the loose cable harnesses. As he attempts to free himself, his left hand slips into an open gear compartment, causing severe crushing injuries due to the rotating machinery components.

In the maintenance area of the SAG mill at level 1200 OB2B, during a routine inspection, an electrician was checking the motor control center when his gloved hand accidentally came into contact with the rotating shaft of the starter motor while attempting to adjust its position using a wrench. The sudden rotation caused severe lacerations on the top and side of the left hand. At the time of the accident, another maintenance worker was nearby, but not directly supervising or assisting the electrician.

During a routine maintenance operation on the conveyor belt system at level 12 of the processing plant, equipment operator Carlos struggled to loosen a stubborn bolt using an impact wrench. As he applied excessive force, the bolt suddenly broke free and struck his right hand with significant force, causing lacerations and bruising across multiple fingers. The incident occurred while Carlos was working alone in the area, approximately 10 meters above ground level. He was immediately taken to the on-site medical facility for treatment and subsequent transport to a nearby hospital for further care.

During a routine maintenance operation on level 3450 OB1A, the mechanic was performing checks on the drilling system of the Atlas truck when he accidentally activated the drill arm lever with his body, causing it to move downwards and strike him against the support tube, resulting in severe injuries. At the time of the accident, another employee was standing nearby observing the operation but did not intervene due to a lack of clear visibility.

In the maintenance bay of the processing plant at Level 2100 OB1A, a technician was attempting to replace a faulty motor on the conveyor belt system when he lost his footing and fell onto the moving belt, getting entangled in its rollers. As the belt continued to operate, it caused severe lacerations to the technician's left leg and ankle area, requiring immediate medical attention.

During routine maintenance at approximately 9:15 a.m., mechanic Juan Carlos attempts to remove a loose bolt from the motor housing of the centrifugal pump CP-12 in the process area PA-3, using an adjustable wrench and standing on a metal ladder placed near the equipment. As he applies force to loosen the bolt, it suddenly breaks off, falling 1.5 meters onto his left foot, causing severe lacerations and bruising.

During a routine maintenance operation on a 300-meter-deep oil well, driller João attempted to loosen a stubborn pipe coupling using an impact wrench while standing on a rickety scaffolding platform. As he applied excessive force, the equipment suddenly jerked out of his hands and swung wildly, striking him in the chest with its heavy metal housing. The blow caused severe bruising and lacerations, leaving João dazed and disoriented. He was quickly evacuated to the on-site medical facility for treatment, where a team of medics worked to stabilize his condition before transporting him to a nearby hospital for further care.

At 14:20 hours, José García, a maintenance worker at the chemical plant, attempted to access an elevated platform by climbing up a rickety ladder while carrying a toolbox weighing approximately 25 kg. As he ascended, his foot slipped on the rung and he lost balance, falling backwards from a height of about 3.2 meters onto the concrete floor below, sustaining injuries to his back and head.

At the Siderúrgica del Norte steel plant's continuous casting machine No. 2, a mechanical failure occurred during maintenance operations on the primary cooling system. The worker responsible for replacing the thermal insulation blanket accidentally triggered the hydraulic system, causing the massive metal beam (weighing approximately 5 tons) to suddenly drop and strike him with considerable force. Despite wearing personal protective equipment, including steel-toed boots and gloves, the operator sustained severe injuries due to the unexpected impact, resulting in a fractured femur and multiple lacerations on his lower extremities.

During the maintenance procedure on a 10-meter-tall storage tank's access ladder, an employee slipped while descending from the top rung due to inadequate handrails and fell approximately 4 meters onto their left shoulder, resulting in severe bruising and limited mobility of the affected area. The incident occurred when another worker was distracted by a nearby equipment malfunction, failing to provide proper assistance or warning to the injured party.

During maintenance work on a conveyor belt system at an industrial facility, a technician was tasked with inspecting a section of the equipment suspended 2.5 meters above ground level using a basket attached to a pulley system. As he reached out to examine a malfunctioning gear, his gloved hand slipped from the metal surface and became entangled in the moving belt's mesh structure. The sudden jerk caused severe lacerations on his left palm and fingers, which were subsequently referred for medical attention at a nearby hospital emergency room.

During maintenance operations on a 500-ton hydraulic press at the manufacturing facility of TechFab Inc., technician Jameson attempted to loosen a stuck piston by applying heat with a blowtorch, causing it to suddenly release and strike his left forearm from approximately 1 meter above ground level, resulting in lacerations.

At 14:10 hours, a maintenance technician attempts to access the upper level of the dryer unit by removing a section of catwalk railing (1.5m x 3m). While doing so, they fail to secure the safety harness and lose their footing on an oily surface, falling approximately 4.2 meters onto a metal grate below, resulting in severe injuries to both legs.

At approximately 1:45 a.m., Mr. Rodriguez was performing routine maintenance on the conveyor belt system when his right arm became entangled in the moving chain, causing severe lacerations and bruising as he attempted to free himself from the machinery's grasp.

During routine maintenance on a 200-meter-long conveyor belt at the processing plant's primary extraction site, employee Rodriguez was tasked with replacing worn-out rollers. As he reached for the third roller from the left edge of the system, his gloved hand slipped off the metal surface and became entangled in the rotating shaft's meshing gears. In an attempt to free himself, Rodriguez inadvertently activated the emergency stop mechanism, causing the entire conveyor belt section to come to a sudden halt. As he struggled to disentangle his arm from the machinery, his left hand was subjected to intense pressure against the stationary gear housing, resulting in severe lacerations and bruising.

At 08:45 hours, Mr. Juan Carlos was performing a routine inspection on the top deck of the storage tank when he accidentally stepped into an open hatchway and fell approximately 3 meters onto a metal grating below. He suffered injuries upon landing and was transported to the medical center for treatment.

During maintenance operations on a high-pressure pipeline at the Petrobras refinery, an employee accidentally triggered the sudden release of pressurized gas while attempting to loosen a stuck valve handle with his bare hands. The resulting explosion sent debris flying in all directions, striking him squarely on the left side of the chest and causing severe bruising and lacerations.

At 09:30 hours, engineer Ana Moreno-GARCIA was conducting a routine inspection on the upper deck of storage tank T-1234 when she lost her footing and fell approximately 3 meters onto the steel grating below. She hit her head against the edge of a nearby ventilation shaft before being rushed to the medical center for treatment.

During routine maintenance on the Centrifuge 345 at level -2500 Acc 5, a technician is instructed by their supervisor to replace a faulty bearing while the machine remains operational in slow rotation mode. As the technician begins disassembling the gearbox, they accidentally trigger the emergency stop button with their gloved hand, causing the centrifugal force to rapidly increase and whip around loose tools on the platform, striking them in the head and shoulder area. The supervisor is standing nearby but unable to intervene due to being tied up in a safety harness securing another worker at height.

During a routine maintenance operation in Cell 42, Row 9, Section 14, an electrician is tasked with inspecting and replacing a faulty transformer on the top level of a steel rack system. As he ascends the ladder, his gloved hand slips off the rung due to excessive wear, causing him to lose balance and fall onto the metal platform below. The impact results in severe bruising and lacerations on both arms, as well as a suspected fracture to the left forearm.

During maintenance work on a 12-meter-tall storage tank's access ladder, technician Carlos was performing a visual inspection when he lost his footing and fell from the top rung to the ground, landing awkwardly with his right shoulder and arm bearing most of the impact force. The fall resulted in a severe injury to his humerus, requiring immediate medical attention and subsequent surgery for internal fixation.

At 08:20 hours, Mr. Juan Carlos Gomez was performing maintenance on a high-pressure gas pipeline in an elevated trench when his safety harness failed due to excessive wear and tear. As he fell approximately 4 meters, his body hit the metal piping, causing severe injuries to his back and head. He was immediately transported to the medical center for emergency treatment.

At approximately 8:20 a.m., during routine maintenance on the conveyor belt system at Level 2100 OB3C, Mr. Antonio was inspecting the idler pulley when his safety harness failed due to wear and tear. As he fell from an elevation of about 4 meters, his arm got caught in the moving chain sprocket, causing a severe laceration on his left forearm.

During maintenance operations on a conveyor belt in the production area, an employee attempts to replace a worn-out rubber roller by lifting it off its mounting bracket using a mechanical hoist. As he is raising the roller, one of the cable's steel strands snaps, causing the heavy load to swing violently and strike the left shoulder of another worker standing nearby, resulting in severe bruising and lacerations requiring immediate medical attention.

At 2:17 pm, during a routine maintenance operation on the chemical processing unit's distillation column, operator Ana reported a sudden loss of pressure in one of the condenser coils via radio communication with her supervisor, Engineer Fernandes. In response, he instructed her to immediately shut down the system and initiate emergency procedures for depressurizing the affected section. However, before she could complete this task, a burst pipe on the column's upper platform released a stream of hot hydrocarbon liquid that sprayed across the catwalk, striking three nearby workers who were not wearing personal protective equipment (PPE). Two employees suffered severe burns and were rushed to the hospital for immediate medical attention; one employee required 12 stitches to treat lacerations.

At approximately 14:45 hours in sector C-3, row 22, Cell 56 of the processing plant, a worker was performing maintenance on a conveyor belt when an unexpected electrical surge caused him to lose his footing and fall from a height of about 2 meters onto a metal grating. The impact resulted in severe lacerations on both knees and a suspected fracture of the left tibia. First aid responders rushed to the scene, immobilized the injured worker's legs, and transported him via ambulance to the nearest hospital for further evaluation and treatment.

During a routine maintenance operation on the conveyor belt 12 in the production hall, one technician removes the floor plate (1m x 2m) to access the underside of the equipment. While attempting to loosen a stubborn bolt with an impact wrench, another worker accidentally drops it from about 50 cm above the ground, and it falls onto his right hand, causing injury due to the forceful impact.

At approximately 8:15 a.m., during routine maintenance on the conveyor belt system in tank C-4212 of the chemical processing unit, operator Maria was attempting to clear a jam when her gloved hand slipped and got caught between two moving rollers with a combined force of approximately 200 kg. The resulting injury caused significant bruising and lacerations to the palm area, requiring immediate medical attention and subsequent hospitalization for treatment.

At approximately 9:15 a.m., during maintenance operations on the conveyor belt system in Sector A of the Facility X, operator Juan Pérez attempted to adjust the tensioning mechanism of the drive pulley (diameter: 40 cm; length: 2 m; weight: 150 kg). As he was loosening the bolts, the pulley suddenly released and fell from a height of approximately 3.8 meters, striking the top of Juan's left hand with significant force.

At approximately 9:45 a.m. on 02/12/19, operator Jorge is performing maintenance tasks inside tank A-3011 of the chemical processing unit when he accidentally drops a metal wrench (2 kg) onto his right foot while attempting to tighten a loose bolt. The impact causes a severe laceration and bruising to the dorsal aspect of his foot, requiring immediate medical attention.

At 13:20 hours, during a routine maintenance operation on the centrifugal pump CP-02 in the processing area of Unit B, Juan Carlos Pérez and his assistant, Jorge Hernández, were attempting to replace a worn-out impeller when it suddenly broke loose from its mounting flange. The freed impeller fell approximately 1.8 meters onto the concrete floor, striking both workers on their lower legs, causing severe bruising and lacerations.

At approximately 2:15 p.m., during a routine maintenance operation on the conveyor belt system at the production facility in Sector A, employee Juan Carlos was attempting to adjust the tension of a loose chain segment when it suddenly snapped back into place, striking his left wrist with considerable force and causing lacerations. The incident occurred while Juan Carlos was standing approximately 1.8 meters away from the affected area, without proper personal protective equipment (PPE) in use at the time of the accident.

During routine maintenance at Level 3456 Shaft 12, a technician climbed onto the conveyor belt platform to inspect the idler wheel's alignment. While checking the tension on the drive belts, he accidentally grasped the rotating shaft with his left hand instead of the stationary frame, causing severe lacerations and bruising as it spun rapidly for approximately 10 seconds before coming to an abrupt stop due to friction from nearby equipment.

At approximately 8:20 a.m., during the maintenance operation on the third level of the production floor, an industrial forklift (model F-100) operated by Juan Sanchez lost control and collided with a stationary metal rack, causing two workers, Carlos Rodriguez and Maria Hernandez, to be struck. The impact resulted in severe injuries to both employees, including lacerations and broken bones. At the time of the accident, the area was not properly secured, and warning signs were absent.

At approximately 11:45 p.m., a maintenance worker was performing routine checks on the pipework in Area B of the refinery when he accidentally triggered a pressure relief valve, causing a sudden release of hot fluids onto his left arm and shoulder area. The incident occurred due to inadequate locking procedures for the isolation valves.

During a routine maintenance operation on Level 1200 OB1A, driller Maria attempted to disconnect the drilling pipe while it was still under pressure from the mud pump. As she released the valve stem, the pipe unexpectedly slid down the drill string, causing her right hand to become entangled in the steel wire rope of the Kelly bushing. The sudden jerk caused a deep laceration on her palm and wrist area, requiring immediate medical attention at the site's infirmary. Maria was subsequently airlifted to a nearby hospital for further treatment and suturing of the wound with 12 stitches. She was out of commission for 14 days due to the severity of the injury.

At 09:30 hours, a mechanical failure occurred during the maintenance operation on conveyor belt #3. As engineer Juan Carlos Hernandez was attempting to clear a blockage at an elevated section of the belt, his safety harness suddenly gave way, causing him to fall approximately 4 meters onto the metal decking below, suffering severe lacerations and contusions in the process. He was promptly transported to the on-site medical facility for emergency treatment.

During the maintenance operation at the processing unit 217; before commencing the replacement of a faulty conveyor belt, the technician crouched down to inspect a damaged section when suddenly the winch system lost its grip and swung towards her, striking her in the lower back with considerable force, resulting in severe injury.

During a routine maintenance check on the conveyor belt system at Level 2100 OB1A, Maintenance Engineer Patel attempted to adjust the tensioning mechanism while standing between two idler rollers. As he was making the adjustment, his gloved hand slipped off the handle and became caught in the moving roller's pinch point, causing severe lacerations and bruising on his left forearm. The incident occurred at approximately 14:45 hours due to a combination of human error and inadequate safety procedures.

At 14:15 hours, during a routine maintenance operation on Level 2400 OB1A of the Rio Grande mine, electrician Ms. Rodriguez was inspecting the electrical panel when she accidentally touched two live wires with her left hand while reaching for a fuse box, causing an electrical shock that threw her backward and resulted in a severe laceration to her left arm.

During a routine maintenance check on the conveyor belt at the Rio Grande mine site, Mr. Rodriguez lost his footing on an oily patch and fell onto the moving belt's return rollers. As he tried to regain balance, his left hand slipped into one of the open rollers' spaces, causing severe crushing injuries to his fingers and wrist. He was rushed to the nearby hospital for emergency surgery.

At 14:20 hours, Mr. García attempts to retrieve a fallen tool from an elevated platform of the concrete mixer truck by climbing up its ladder with both hands occupied holding the tool and his hard hat. As he reaches for the platform's edge, his foot slips on the wet surface due to recent rain, causing him to lose balance and fall backwards approximately 3 meters onto the metal deck below, resulting in a severe head injury.

At approximately 3:45 a.m., during routine maintenance on the B-12 compressor station, Mr. Sanchez is attempting to tighten a loose bolt on the machinery when it suddenly slips from his grasp and strikes his left forearm with significant force. The impact causes an immediate laceration requiring prompt medical attention.

At 03:45 a.m., during routine maintenance in the processing area of Unit B, worker Javier is inspecting the conveyor belt system when he accidentally steps into an open gap between two sections of piping, causing his left foot to become trapped and crushed by the moving pipes' mechanical pressure.

At 08:30 hours, Pedro Sanchez-REYES was performing maintenance on a conveyor belt when he accidentally triggered an alarm, causing a sudden shutdown of the machinery. As he attempted to exit the area, he lost his footing and fell approximately 2 meters onto the concrete floor, suffering severe injuries that required immediate medical attention at the site's infirmary.

During a routine maintenance operation on a 200-ton press at approximately 2:15 p.m., employee Carlos Sanchez accidentally activated the machine's hydraulic system, causing it to suddenly move and crush his left leg between two metal plates. The incident occurred while Sanchez was attempting to clear debris from the press's operating area without following proper safety protocols. At the time of the accident, the press was not properly secured or locked out for maintenance, despite being marked with warning signs indicating that work was in progress.

During a routine maintenance check on Level 2100 OB1A, Engineer Silva was inspecting the Atlas truck parked near Cruise 420 when he accidentally triggered the boom's automatic deployment mechanism while attempting to clear debris from the vehicle's canopy. The uncontrolled extension of the boom struck and pinned Engineer Silva against the adjacent rock face, causing severe bruising on his left side and a deep laceration above his right eyebrow.

On February 10th at approximately 14:30 hours in the drilling operation area of Explomin's DDH chamber, level -100 Socorro ramp 334, a mechanical failure occurred during the removal of drill rod #7 (NQ-3 meters of steel with a weight of 32 kg). Drill operator Carlos attempted to loosen the rod using an adjustable wrench (#10) while simultaneously operating the rotation unit. The sudden release of tension caused by the malfunctioning mechanism resulted in the drill rod falling from its holder, striking Carlos's left hand and causing lacerations on his index finger. The incident was reported immediately, and Carlos received medical attention at the company clinic where he underwent suturing with 12 stitches. He was subsequently placed under a three-day observation period for further treatment.

At approximately 3:45 a.m., in the north wing of the processing facility at level -20 of the Río Blanco mine, an incident occurred when Mr. Hernández was performing routine maintenance on the conveyor belt system. While inspecting the pulley wheels, he accidentally dropped his toolbox (weighing 12 kg) from a height of approximately 3 meters onto his right foot. The impact caused significant bruising and swelling to the affected area.

At approximately 2:15 pm, during a routine maintenance operation on the conveyor belt system at Level 1230 OB1A, mechanic Carlos was attempting to loosen a stuck roller bearing using a hydraulic jack and socket wrench. As he applied pressure, the bearing suddenly released and fell from a height of about 60 cm onto his left hand, causing severe lacerations and crushing injuries.

At approximately 14:45 hours on August 12th, while performing routine maintenance tasks at Tank D-4023 of the sulfuric acid production stage, operator João suffered a severe ankle sprain after stepping into an uncovered drain pit with uneven flooring. As he attempted to regain balance, his right hand grasped onto a nearby railing, causing strain and discomfort in his wrist. The incident was reported immediately, and medical attention was sought at the on-site infirmary before being transferred to Hospital São Luís for further treatment.

During a routine maintenance operation on the conveyor belt system at the mining facility, Mr. Santos lost his footing on an oily surface and fell from a height of 2.5 meters onto the metal grating below. He tried to break his fall by outstretching his right arm but suffered a severe fracture near the elbow joint as he landed awkwardly. The injured employee was promptly transported to the nearby hospital for emergency medical treatment.

ACTIVITY: rock bolting (installation of anchors) LOCAL: underground mine, level 220 - rear 30 Upper JKA

During rock bolting operations at a depth of approximately 550 meters, operator Carlos failed to properly secure the anchor rod before tightening the nut. As he applied force, the unsecured rod suddenly released and swung back towards him with great velocity, striking his left temple and causing severe lacerations. The mine's emergency response team promptly responded and transported Carlos to the hospital for medical treatment. He underwent surgery to repair a depressed skull fracture and required 12 stitches to close the wound.

At 14:20 hours, José Luis González, a maintenance worker at the Petrochemical Plant of Puebla, was attempting to replace a faulty valve on a pipeline when he lost his footing and fell from an elevated platform approximately 3 meters high, landing awkwardly on his left shoulder. The impact caused severe bruising and lacerations requiring immediate medical attention.

At 10:45 p.m., during a routine maintenance check on the steam generator's superheater tubes in unit B of the power plant, Mr. Rodriguez accidentally knocks over a toolbox while attempting to retrieve a wrench from the top shelf. The tool box falls onto his left foot, causing crushing injuries and severe pain due to the heavy contents inside.

During a routine maintenance operation on the 12th level of the processing plant's vertical silo, mechanical engineer Carlos inadvertently activated the automated conveyor system while attempting to clear a blockage in one of its sections. As he struggled to disengage the machinery, his right hand became entangled in the moving chain links, causing severe lacerations and crushing injuries. The incident occurred at approximately 2:15 am, when most employees were on their morning breaks or still commuting from home. Carlos was rushed to a nearby hospital for emergency treatment, where he underwent surgery requiring multiple skin grafts and remained hospitalized for an extended period of recovery.

In section 21 in row 9 Cell 42, a maintenance worker is performing routine inspection on electrical panel CP-12 when he accidentally touches exposed live wire with his right hand while attempting to access a faulty circuit breaker, causing severe burns and lacerations. The incident occurs at approximately 14:45 hours during regular working shift, without any warning signs or alarms sounding prior to the accident.

On August 12th at approximately 2:45 pm, a maintenance worker was performing routine checks on a malfunctioning gear box of the conveyor belt system in sector B-2345 of the mining facility. While attempting to tighten a loose bolt with an adjustable wrench, his sleeve caught onto the rotating shaft, causing him to lose balance and fall against the metal railing. The impact resulted in severe bruising and lacerations on his left side, as well as a minor concussion. He was promptly attended by medical personnel and transported to the facility's infirmary for further treatment.

On Level 2100 OB3A, during a routine maintenance operation on the Atlas truck, Operator Maria removed the safety chain and began inspecting the drill bit when an unexpected movement of the vehicle caused her to lose balance, resulting in a severe laceration above her left eyebrow requiring immediate medical attention.

In the maintenance area of the cement plant's kiln 3, a technician was replacing a worn-out refractory brick on the burner floor when he lost his balance and fell onto an exposed electrical conduit, injuring his right arm after coming into contact with live wires. The fall occurred while attempting to retrieve a dropped tool from a narrow space between two large machinery components.

At 09:30 hours, José Luis Gómez-MENDOZA was performing maintenance on a crane at level +2000 Acc 3 when he accidentally activated the winch system with his body, causing the cable reel to suddenly drop and hit him against the support beam of the crane's boom. The impact resulted in severe lacerations and contusions. At the time of the accident, Gómez-MENDOZA was alone on the platform while a colleague was monitoring the operation from ground level.

During a routine maintenance operation on the 12-inch pipeline at the Petrobras platform, an employee was struck by falling debris when a section of corroded pipe ruptured suddenly due to excessive pressure. The victim suffered severe lacerations and fractures upon impact with the concrete walkway, requiring immediate medical attention and subsequent airlift transport to a nearby hospital for further treatment.

During the maintenance operation on a 12-meter-tall storage tank, two workers were involved in securing the access ladder while another worker was inspecting the tank's interior from an elevated platform suspended by ropes at approximately 8 meters above ground level. The inspection process required the worker to extend his arm through a narrow opening to reach for equipment inside the tank when suddenly he lost balance and fell, landing awkwardly on his left shoulder due to the confined space constraints, resulting in reported injuries.

At 14:15 on 02/12/19, operator Javier is injured while attempting to retrieve a stuck valve handle in tank T-3051 of the chemical mixing stage. While leaning over the edge with his right hand for support, he loses balance and falls onto the metal ladder rungs below, sustaining a severe strain injury to his left shoulder.

In section 3B at level -3456 Acc 9, a maintenance worker is performing routine inspections on the hydraulic system of the Pneumatic Press Model PR-5000 when he accidentally activates the press arm while trying to clear debris from the control panel's electrical components. The sudden movement causes his left hand to become entangled in the moving parts, resulting in severe lacerations and a broken finger bone. At the time of the accident, no other personnel were present on site, with only occasional passing workers reporting hearing a loud noise coming from that area.

During a routine maintenance procedure on the 300-meter-high stack at the refinery plant, operator José noticed excessive vibrations in the platform's handrail system. As he attempted to secure it with a temporary wire rope tie-off, his gloved hands slipped due to the oily surface and lost grip of the rail. The weight of his body caused him to fall approximately three meters onto the steel grating below, resulting in severe bruising on both shoulders and hips. After being assisted by colleagues, José was transported to the plant's infirmary for medical attention and subsequently sent home with a 7-day recuperation period.

At approximately 8:30 a.m., during routine maintenance on the conveyor belt system at the production facility of company TecnoIndustria, operator Carlos attempted to replace a faulty motor bearing while standing atop an elevated platform (height: 3 meters). As he loosened the bolt securing the motor housing, it suddenly detached and fell from its mounting bracket, striking him in the left shoulder with considerable force. The impact caused Carlos to lose his balance, resulting in a fall of approximately 2.5 meters onto the concrete floor below, exacerbating the injury.
